Title: Accounts Payable - Payments - Advanced Search - Checking the Bank filter list control (Run OK)
Description:
Check that:
 
BankId filter list returns all available banks from TBM_RANK
- Should we be returning inactive banks??? Possible, if we want to see historical records? (but we would want to limit interaction with these records)
 
BankId can search on both Bank codes and bank full name
- Can match search terms in the middle of the bank full name
- Search term match beginning and end of bank full name
 
BankId is a filter list - number of banks supported is likely to be limited, so filter list is fine
Steps: Step 1: Banks can be managed in Expert Classic:Hub Setup -> Time and Billing Setup -> Banks || Step 2: Payments tab -> Advanced search ribbonCheck the Bank button | Expected: Bank is available as a filter list || Step 3: Open the Bank Search control | Expected: All Banks in the database is immediately returned (unsure if filtering on INACTIVE), as the search control is a filter listSource of data is TBM_BANK || Step 4: Search for banks based on Bank Code | Expected: Entries are filtered based on Bank Code || Step 5: Search for banks based on Bank Full Name | Expected: Entries are filtered based on matching the Bank Full NameBank full name is stored in HBM_NAME (use Name_UNO to link TBM_BANK and HBM_NAME) || Step 6: Testing full text searchSearch for bank names with terms that match the end of the bank name e.g. "Ontario"Search for bank names with terms that match the middle of the bank name e.g. "# 1" | Expected: List of banks are filtered as per the matching search terms

Title: Accounts Payable - Payments - Advanced Search - Checking the 1099 Amount search textbox control (Run Failed, see linked bug)
Description:
Could not type in the negative symbol sometimes, especially using the key in numpad. 
Therefore, could not test on entering a negative value.
 
is it worth to test if we should include value for decimal point as well.
 
It allow non-numeric input and return all entries when search.
Steps: Step 1: Go to Payments Tab -> Advanced search ribbon and check the 1099 Amount checkbox. Right click on Grid > Column > tick 1099 Amount if it is not showing this column | Expected: 1099 Amount is available as search list || Step 2: Search using positive numbers e.g. > 500, < 10000, and verify the results via SQL | Expected: The returned results matches searches on theTEN99_AMT column from APT_CHECK. || Step 3: Search using positive numbers e.g. > -100, < -5, and verify the results via SQL | Expected: The returned results matches searches on theTEN99_AMT column from APT_CHECK. It's quite unlikely that we'll have entries with negative amounts... but we need to check if the control copes with negative amounts. || Step 4: Search using 0 as the term e.g. >0, < 0 , and 0 | Expected: The returned results matches searches on theTEN99_AMT column from APT_CHECK. || Step 5: Search with an exact number with decimals, by looking in APT_CHECK for an entry and then searching with its 1099 amount. | Expected: The entry we found in APT_CHECK is returned in the app

Title: Accounts Payable - Payments - Advanced Search - Checking the Request number textbox control (Run OK)
Description:
Request numbers are based in APT_CHECK
 
Int-only field - so we'd expect to not allow strings into the field
 
We also seem to allow special characters like dots and dashes - this probably a bug, as we should only allow numeric only fields unless we are retrieving ranges
Steps: Step 1: Request numbers are sourced from APT_CHECK, look in this table to confirm your search results. || Step 2: Go to the Payments tab, and check the available search filters. | Expected: Request number is a search field that has been enabled by default. || Step 3: Enter in a valid request number, 20 | Expected: The expected payment entry is returned || Step 4: Enter in a very long request number that does not match any existing patments | Expected: No payments returned || Step 5: Enter special characters into the field | Expected: No inputs accepted

Title: Accounts Payable - Payments - Advanced Search - Checking the Payment Amount textbox control (Run failed, see linked bug)
Description:
Payment Amount searches based on APT_CHECK.CHK_AMT i.e. if we're looking for checks more than $5000, CHK_AMT is the column used in the search criteria evaluation
 
This is an amount field - we'd expect to allow users to use comparators to refine their search here:
< 5000 returns all checks with check amounts less than 5000
> 1000 returns all checks with check amounts greater than 1000
 
It's also a decimal field - so searching with decimal units is possible. 
 
Purpose of entering as many units as the field will accept is to ensure we handle these situations gracefully - as in the case of other apps, this has caused crashes due to value conversion failures due to overflows (number is too large to be converted)
Steps: Step 1: Go to Payments tab, and enable Payment amount from the Advanced search ribbon | Expected: Payment amount is a QBE filter search, allowing users to enter in comparators || Step 2: Enter in an amount that exactly matches what a check has | Expected: All checks with the exact amount entered are returnedResults returned matches what we see in APT_CHECK.CHK_AMT || Step 3: Search for checks under a certain amount e.g. < 100000 | Expected: All checks with amounts under this figure are returned || Step 4: Search for checks above a certain amount e.g. >5000 | Expected: All checks with amounts above this figure are returned || Step 5: Search for checks with an amount that has a very long decimal place (enter as many units as the field will accept) | Expected: Checks returned if they match your condition (if comparators are used e.g. > 500.55623124321) || Step 6: Search for checks with a very large amount (enter as many units as the field will accept) | Expected: No checks returned (unless comparators used e.g. < 100 billion)

Title: Accounts Payable - Invoices - Invoice lock, having different users opening an unreleased invoice in AP at once
Steps: Step 1: You must have at least one released but unposted invoice created for this test. Refer to Step two if needed. || Step 2: Open an unposted invoice as yourself. | Expected: Invoice not allow to be edit when in Release state || Step 3: Unrelease the chosen invoice and try to make changes then save. | Expected: Invoice should now allowed to be edit || Step 4: As a different user (eg, TTQA1), open the same invoice in another AP window | Expected: Prompted by invoice is locked by another user and will be opened in read only mode. Also showing who the invoice is locked by. || Step 5: As locked out user (TTQA1), attempt on edit the invoice | Expected: Attempt fail || Step 6: As non-locked out user, attempt on edit the invoice | Expected: Attempt successful || Step 7: As non-locked out user, save, release and close the invoice. || Step 8: As locked out user (TTQA1), close the invoice and reopen it. | Expected: Able to unrelease and edit invoice.

Title: Accounts Payable - Invoices - Payment Details Hover can be viewed for each posted invoice with payment details (Run OK)
Description:
The following are the payment details we expect to display per posted invoice:
 
- Posted direct credit
- Posted check
- Unposted check
- Unposted payment schedule check
 
There is also the possibility of cancellations, which we also look at in this test case
 
We do not specifically look at mult-payments, or having a mix of payments per invoice, or any performance concerns in this test case.
 
Note for testers: Latest data is fetched per search; the payment details displayed depends on the state of the data at the time the invoice search was performed, as related payment detail is retrieved at the time of searching for invoices.
Steps: Step 1: Locate the invoice which you created with posted direct credit. Mouse over to the status field. | Expected: Hover should display these fields1. Payment Date - No labels displayed, just the Date2. Payee - No labels displayed, just the Payee3. Payment amount 4. Total payment amout5. Payment Reference - the reference value entered on the Wire check is displayed here.6. Reconciled - Set to No, unless it is cancelled.A link to view more of the Payment details is also available in the hover detail.Since the payment is posted, the letter P is displayed with a green background. || Step 2: If you don't have any unposted and posted checks, follow the shared step below. || Step 3: Locate the invoice which you created with the unposted check. Mouse over to the status field | Expected: Hover should display these fields1. Payment Date - No labels displayed, just the Date2. Payee - No labels displayed, just the Payee3. Payment Amount4. Total Check AmountA link to view more of the Payment details is also available in the hover detail.Since the payment is posted, the letter U is displayed with an orange background. || Step 4: Locate the invoice which you created with posted check in Invoices list. Mouse over to the status field. | Expected: Hover should display these fields1. Payment Date - No labels displayed, just the Date2. Payee - No labels displayed, just the Payee3. Payment Amount 4. Total Check Amount5. Check Number (only shows when a check is printed as that is when a check number is assigned)6. Reconciled is set to No, unless the payment is cancelledA link to view more of the Payment details is also available in the hover detail.Since the payment is posted, the letter P is displayed with a green background. || Step 5: Locate the invoice which you created with the unposted payment schedule. Mouse over to the Status field. | Expected: Hover should display these fields1. Payment Date - No labels displayed, just the Date2. Payee - No labels displayed, just the Payee3. Payment Schedule NoA link to view more of the Payment details is also available in the hover detail.Since the payment is unposted, the letter U is displayed with an orange background. || Step 6: Locate the invoice that has had one of its checks reversed. | Expected: Hover should display these fields1. Payment Date - No labels displayed, just the Date2. Payee - No labels displayed, just the Payee3. Payment Amount - This is in brackets to indicate a negative amount4. Total Check Amount5. Check Number (only shows when a check is printed as that is when a check number is assigned)6. Reconciled is set to Yes, since this is a reversal transaction.A link to view more of the Payment details is also available in the hover detail.Since the payment is posted, the letter P is displayed with a green background. || Step 7: Hover to any invoice with no payment (posted or unposted) | Expected: No additional payment details are available

Title: Invoice - Release/Unrelease - Release Validation
Steps: Step 1: Display of error- Via a job- Via an invoice | Expected: Display in Recent Activities tab.Display in red alert bar. || Step 2: LockingInvoice is already locked 1. Open an invoice that is C.2. Keep the invoice open and go to the grid and select the invoice.3. Attempt to release the invoice. | Expected: Display error: 'Opened and locked in another view'Can't lock the invoice || Step 3: Complete and Edit List not printedCannot release unless edit list is printed. 1. Invoice in C status.2. Set APM_PARMS.EDIT_LIST = 'Y'.3. Attempt to release invoice. | Expected: Display error : Edit List is required.Invoice not released. || Step 4: Release with no detail lineCannot release without detail line 1. Create an invoice with an amount <> 0 with no detail items2. Update invoice to Complete via sql.  3. Refresh grid.4. Attempt to release invoice from grid. | Expected: Display error : Invoice details total do not match. (along with Vendor and Invoice number)Invoice not released. || Step 5: Release with detail line not equal to invoice totalCannot release when detail line total <> Invoice total 1. Create an invoice with an amount <> 0 and detail line total <> Invoice Amount2. Update inoice to Complete via sql.  3. Refresh grid.4. Attempt to release invoice from grid. | Expected: Display error : Invoice details total do not match. (along with Vendor and Invoice number)Invoice not released. || Step 6: Release with zero amount Invoice with no detail lineCannot release without detail line 1. Create an invoice with zero amount with no detail items2. Update invoice to Complete via sql.  3. Refresh grid.4. Attempt to release invoice from grid. | Expected: Display Error : Cannot release invoice without detail lines.Invoice not released.*Bug 176213 - Invoice Release - To validate Invoice missing detail line on Invoice Release. || Step 7: Release with Invoice Date out of rangeInvoice date cannot be out of parms date. 1. Create an invoice with C status.2. Update the Invoice Date via SQL to be out of parms date range.3. Refresh grid 4. Attempt to release invoice from grid | Expected: Display Error : Invoice date if out of range.Invoice not released. || Step 8: Release with no Recoverable Tax when neededWhen Recoverable Tax is needed, cannot release without one. 1. Create an invoice with C status.2. Set APM_PARMS.RECOV_CONT_REQD = 'Y'3. Refresh grid4. Attempt to release invoice from grid. | Expected: Display Error : Tax details do not match. (along with Vendor and Invoice number)Invoice not released. || Step 9: Release with Recoverable Tax not matched with Tax amountWhen Recoverable Tax is not equal to Tax amount 1. Set APM_PARMS.RECOV_CONT_REQD = 'Y'.2. Create an invoice with C status., with Jurisdiction and Tax Include = 'Y'.3. Calculate Tax, tax detail lines created.4. Set Recoverable Tax <> Total Taxes amount.5. Relese invoice, on entry screen or grid. | Expected: Display Error : Tax details do not match. (along with Vendor and Invoice number)Invoice not released. * bug 176262 - Invoice Release - 'Tax details do not match' error on valid invoice entry. || Step 10: Name uno of the remit vendor matches the one linked to the bank account.1 .Have a vendor(1) with a bank account.2. Have another vendor(2) that uses the first vendor(1) as a remittance vendor and also has bank account details.3. Create a complete invoice with the second vendor(2) and the AP Type that corresponds to the first vendors (1) bank.4. Using SQL, change the bank account uno to the second vendors(2) bank account.5. Release the invoice. | Expected: Invoice is not released.Error that the bank account is not related to the remit vendor. || Step 11: Bank account from a different bank then the AP Types bank.1. Have a vendor with a bank account (e.g. for BOT).2. Create an invoice with an AP Type that has a bank that does not correspond to the bank accounts (e.g. INE).3. Change the Bank_Acct_Uno in SQL to the bank account in step 1.4. Release the invoice. | Expected: Invoice is not released.Errors that the bank for the invoice and bank details are different. || Step 12: Inactive AP Type 1. Existing Recurring Invoice2. Inactivate the AP Type3. Generate invoiceNote: The invoice will be created and a release will be attempted. | Expected: Error on invoice release822 EX0011

Title: AP: Region format setting - Date format change according to region format setting in local machine
Steps: Step 1: go to Control Panel > Clock, Language and Region > Change date, time or number formats | Expected: Take note of your format (English, New Zealand) under the Format tab. || Step 2: Open AP and take note of the date format of your invoice date. day-month-year | Expected: eg, 25/12/2015 || Step 3: Change the date format to English, United State from Region setting in step 1. || Step 4: Restart AP app | Expected: Date format of invoice date is now month-day-year. eg, 12/25/2015

Title: Accounts Payable - Persistance of Application Preferences - Application state similar to when user left it
Steps: Step 1: Open AP Application. Maximize the window. Close it and reopen AP. | Expected: AP should stay maximised when re-open || Step 2: Minimise AP main window. Close it and reopen. | Expected: Window size should remain the same when reopen. || Step 3: When having more than one monitor, move AP main window to other monitor. Close and reopen AP. | Expected: AP will re-open in other monitor || Step 4: In the Grid, click on one of the column header (eg, Invoice Date). Your list will be sorted according to this column. Close and reopen AP. | Expected: Invoices are still being sorted according to the column header you clicked when return results. || Step 5: Drag and drop one of the column header (eg, Invoice Date) between any two columns. Close and reopen AP | Expected: Column sequence remain same as before closing the application. || Step 6: In Advanced Search, untick some of the filters. Close and Reopen AP | Expected: Unticked filters will not show in search panel even reopen AP

Title: Accounts Payable - Grid - Mouse Right click Selection (Run passed)
Steps: Step 1: Open AP > Invoices List Screen. search to return some entries. || Step 2: Select an invoice from the list | Expected: The whole row will be highlighted. || Step 3: Scroll your mouse to other invoices. | Expected: Rows which you mouse over will be highlighted in darker blue. Note that the row you selected in step 2 still remain highlighted in lighter blue. || Step 4: Right click and Select All | Expected: All rows are highlighted. || Step 5: Right click and Select None | Expected: None selected hence no rows are highlighted || Step 6: Select one row, right click and Reverse Select | Expected: Everything else is selected but not the row you selected || Step 7: Multiple select. Ctrl + Mouse Left click to select multiple rows then Reverse Select | Expected: Multiple rows selected. All selected but not the one selected before when Reverse Select

Title: AP Setup - Vendor Group Code
Steps: Step 1: Set up vendors using shared step in Step 2 if you do not have any vendor to work with || Step 2: Open Expert Administration > AP > AP Options> Vendor Groups || Step 3: Add a new vendor group code by click the "plus" sign.ID: RENTDescription: Office Rental Is Active: YesClick save | Expected: Office Rental with Rent as code is created. It is stored in APL_VENDGRP table || Step 4: Under Attach Vendor, double click on 3 vendors so that they move from the left (Available) to right (Selected). Click Save | Expected: Selected vendors will appear on the right pane (Selected) of the list ordered by Vendor ID. Verify the list with APA_VENDOR_GRP.select VENDOR_NAME, * from APA_VENDOR_GRP a  left join apm_vendor b on a.VEND_UNO = b.VENDOR_UNO where vendgrp_code = 'RENT' || Step 5: Unattach one of the vendors. Click Save | Expected: Vendor will move from right pane to left pane and ordered by Vendor IDVerify the list with select VENDOR_NAME, * from APA_VENDOR_GRP a  left join apm_vendor b on a.VEND_UNO = b.VENDOR_UNO where vendgrp_code = 'RENT' || Step 6: Use '<' and '>' for attach and unattach the same vendor removed | Expected: Vendor is moved from Available to Selected list and vice versa. || Step 7: Use 'Add All' and 'Remove All' to attach and unattach vendors to the group. | Expected: Whole list are being attach and unattached as expected. Result is also consistent with table APA_VENDOR_GRP || Step 8: Attach a vendor to group again. || Step 9: Delete the group | Expected: Not possible to delete with vendor attached to group. Delete button will be invisible.  25/11/2019 - Samuel Powell - Deleting button is enabled, however saving the deletion of the vendor group is prevented with popup. || Step 10: Remove All vendors from the group then Delete the Group | Expected: Group deleted succesfully

Title: Accounts Payable - Invoices - Create New Invoice smartform validation check
Steps: Step 1: For each fields, make sure they are displaying the right information from their associated table. Changes only visible when the smartform is closed and restarted.eg, Vendor should display active Vendor only from table APM_VENDOR || Step 2: Check Discount Amount, Discount Date and Due Date:Enter 100 USD as Amount. Set Payment Terms to 2%10.Date as Today | Expected: These fields will be automatically populatedDiscount Amount: 2USDDiscount Date: 10 days from current dateDue Date: 30 days from current date || Step 3: Check Invoice DateInvoice Date Range come from table APM_PARMS. Any date outside of the range is invalid. || Step 4: Check 1099 Type and AmountThese two will be enabled/disabled depend on its flag value in CMS_OPTION | Expected: If Flag Value is Y for 1099_IN_USE, then this field will be shown. else, not showing. || Step 5: Check Smartform using Withhold Tax CheckboxTo make this field visible in smartform,make sure this field is checked in Design Studio > Expert AP > Invoice Entry > Invoice Entry Right > Elements > Withhold Tax. Save and CloseRun this query to indicate this firm is using Withholding Taxupdate CMS_OPTION set FLAG_VALUE ='Y'where option_code ='WHTAX_IN_USE' | Expected: Withhold Tax Checkbox is now visible in smartform || Step 6: AP Type is inactive 822.Ex00111. AP Type needs to have been used before so its in the MRU2. Select inactive AP Type | Expected: Error message: The selected AP Type is inactive || Step 7: AP Type is not in this book 822.Ex00111. AP Type needs to have been used before so its in the MRU2. Select book3. Select AP Type that is not for this book | Expected: Error message: Type code selected is associated with a bank that is not attached to the booked selected

Title: Accounts Payable - Payments  - Advanced Search - Checking the 1099 Amount search control
Description: A quick check on the 1099 Amount filter search in Payment List screen.
Steps: Step 1: Create a posted check with $100 as 1099 Amount || Step 2: In new AP, search for '100' in 1099 Amount filter search. | Expected: The check you posted is listed in the grid.

Title: Accounts Payable - Invoices - Payment Details hover for Invoice with Multiple Payment
Steps: Step 1: Follow Step 3 on how to post a check, but instead of making full payment, pay only a quarter of the full amount. || Step 2: Go to new AP then Invoices section tab, locate the invoice you created. | Expected: Created invoice will be in the list || Step 3: Go to Status column and put your cursor on the 'i' icon. | Expected: A payment details pane appear as you hover over the 'i' icon, showing the amount you made. The invoice status should be 'Partially Paid' || Step 4: Repeat Step 2 and 3 two times, each time pay another quarter of full amount. | Expected: 3 quarter of total amount is pay. || Step 5: Check the payment details pane again in Invoice List screen. | Expected: The payment details pane will list three payments which you already made. Invoice status remain as 'Partially Paid' || Step 6: Now make payment for the remaining amount. | Expected: Full invoice amount have been paid. || Step 7: Check payment details pane in Invoice List Screen. | Expected: Payment details pane will list four payments made. Invoice status is now 'Outstanding'. || Step 8: Tool tips off | Expected: Hover still displays

Title: Upgrade - Invoices - Conversion script of old invoice status into new invoice status
Description:
Check that:
 
Old invoices have been converted as expected per described logic in the user story (logic is in the linked task workitem actually - 131592).
 
Include shared steps on how to create invoices in appshell, and how to make payments vs invoices.
Steps: Step 1: Conversion script is at$/ExpertSuite/Dev/AP/Modules/Database/Src/Database/Scripts/Post-Deployment/APT_INVOICE_expert_invoice_status.sql | Expected: Old invoice statuses are converted to new expert_invoice_status || Step 2: Create invoice in Classic AP for each statuses1. Incomplete - unmatch detail line with invoice amount2. Complete / Ready for Posting3. Release4. Outstanding5. Settled6. Part Paid7. Cancelled || Step 3: Upgrade || Step 4: Verify the entries- Update scripts for Expert statuses should update all rows correctly | Expected: Invoice with no details line or with unallocated balance> Incomplete, I Invoice with details line and ready to post > Complete, CRelease Invoice > Released, RPosted Invoice > Outstanding, OPaid Invoice > Settled, SPart Paid Invoice > Part Paid, PCancelled Invoice  > Cancelled, XBug : 259816 Update scripts for Expert Statuses does not update all rows correctly

Title: Accounts Payable - Application - Accounts Payable is only accessible if a firm license is present (Run OK)
Steps: Step 1: SetupIf an entry exists under Technical.Licensing.License for ExpertAccountsPayable, delete this config entry.Also Check if any entries exist under Technical.Licensing.Status for AccountsPayable_ExpertAccountsPayableApplication. Delete this entry too.Open Security manager, and load the Accounts Payable Module policy. Ensure you have the ExpertAccountsPayableApplication security resource granted to your user or user group. | Expected: Alternatively you can deploy using a fresh database, but that might take longer. || Step 2: Open ExpertAccountsPayable from expertshare. | Expected: A dialog stating license is required is displayed for the user || Step 3: Import the license (located from the Application.Accountspayable module in source control) via Design Studio or Deployment manager | Expected: You want the tester version of the license, not the dev version. || Step 4: Open ExpertAccountsPayable from expertshare. | Expected: Application launched successfully; whether you can create invoices or payments is dependent on the security resources you have been granted in Security manager.

Title: Accounts Payable - Invoices - Create New Invoice in New AP
Accounts Payable - Ability to open multiple invoices and payments at the same time
Steps: Step 1: In new AP, go to Invoices Tab. Search and open multiple invoices to open. Select invoice from upper tabs. | Expected: Invoices will be open and can be navigate through the upper tabs. || Step 2: Open one nvoice and back to Invoices Tab | Expected: Invoices Tab should retain how you left it. It should still display your last searched invoices || Step 3: In Payment Tab, search and open multiple payments. Navigate through opened payments from the upper tabs | Expected: Payment will be open and can be navigate through the upper tabs || Step 4: Open one payment and go back to Payments Tab | Expected: Payments should retain how you left it. It should still display your last searched payments || Step 5: Open an invoice (which had been opened) from the grid | Expected: Screen will jump to the invoice which you already open instead of open a new tab for the same invoice.

Title: Accounts Payable - Invoices - Having more than 20 payment details associated with an invoice does not impact Payment detail hover display
Steps: Step 1: You need a posted invoice with more than 20 payment transactions associated with the invoice. If required, follow the shared steps to create the transactions || Step 2: Search for the invoice, and click on the information button to open the Payment hover detail dialog. | Expected: All related payment information (can verify in APT_INVOICE_AMT) are returned in the payment hover detail dialog.Check accuracy including payment amount, date, and posted status.Dialog is opened quickly, and if taking a little bit longer, shows the spinning cursor to indicate things are still running.

Title: Accounts Payable - Invoices - Payment details hover for an Invoice with multiple payments
Steps: Step 1: In Appshell, crate an invoice with these details based on Test Case 130344Control Total: 300Click Ok and Click Add in Detail ColumnVendor: 1102 Inv No: MULTITESTInv Amt: 300 Reference: MultitestPmt terms: NT30Narrative: Testing on payment details hover 1099 Type: INTPress OK | Expected: USD is selected after Vendor 1102 is chosen.Detail column will be enabled afte pressing OK || Step 2: Select G/L in detail and fill the details inAccount: 61050Office: AUKDepartment: ADMProfit Center: FIRMDebit Amt: 300Close and Post. | Expected: Unallocated Bal of invoice will be 0.00Session's Control total will be equal to Detail totalSession posted succesfully || Step 3: In AP > Check EntryDoc Type: CheckPayee Type: VendorVendor: 1102Bank: BOTAmount (the field beside the currency in turquoise check form): 100Click Ok | Expected: Detail column is enabled. || Step 4: In Detail column, select Invoice Pmt and enter the invoice details as above withPayment Amount: 100Release, Print and Post | Expected: Invoice is printed, in our case printed in Snagit.Check is posted succesful || Step 5: Repeat step 3 to 4 again twice. | Expected: You will have made 3 x 100USD payment. || Step 6: Open new AP > Invoices section , search with Invoice Number to locate the invoice you created. Mouse over to Status information icon. | Expected: Hover over the icon will display a summary details of the payments made to the invoice (Which may not display all payments).Clicking the icon will have a pop out window showing the summary details (more number of payments if any) along with a hyperlink which direct you to the Payment record.

Title: Accounts Payable - Invoices - Payment details hover for an Invoice with cancelled payment
Steps: Step 1: If you do not have any existing invoice in Appshell > Accounts Payable > Invoice Entry.Read linked test cases if not sure. | Expected: Have an invoice created. || Step 2: Back to appshell and go to Check Cancellation.Enter the request number. (you can also look for your request number in APT_CHECK)Hit Reverse when you found your check.Fill in the fields as requested, do not left out the transaction date. | Expected: Check is reversed/cancelled. || Step 3: Now go to new AP > Invoice section and locate the invoice with payment you cancelled. || Step 4: Mouse over the information icon in Status column. | Expected: Payment details will appear when you hover over to the information icon. You should able to see the payment which you cancelled with hyperlink directing you to the cancellation record.

Title: Accounts Payable - Invoices - Two users opening the same invoice, one in Classic and one in new AP - To be continue (check summary)
Description: It is not confirm yet if AP and Classic should be supported by each other at this point. Test case will be review in future.
Steps: Step 1: You must have at least one invoice created for this test. Refer to shared step below if do not have one. | Expected: An invoice created. || Step 2: Open an instance of unposted invoice in new AP as TTQA1, unrelease it to enable edit | Expected: Edit is allowed || Step 3: Open the same invoice in Classic. | Expected: Get notify that invoice only available as read only. Edit is not allowed. || Step 4: Close both invoicies on new AP and Classic || Step 5: Open an unposted invoice (could be the same one from Step 1) in Classic. Try to edit it. | Expected: Edit is allowed || Step 6: Open the same invoice in new AP as TTQA1 | Expected: Get notify that invoice only available as read only. Edit is not allowed. || Step 7: Attempt to make edit as TTQA1 in new AP | Expected: Edit is not allowed || Step 8: Close the invoice opened in Classic. Reopen the invoice in new AP and try to edit | Expected: Edit is allowed

Title: Invoices: Security - Users with CreateInvoice rights can create new invoices, those who do not can only edit invoices
Description:
Testing approach
 
Users with the security rights can create invoices:
- Create invoice button is enabled 
- Invoices can be saved if all required information on the form has been filled in
 
Users without the security right are still able to:
- NOT able to create invoices
 
It's also natural that if the user does not have the ability to create invoices, they would want to view existing invoices
- Check if the user has ViewInvoice enabled, then the user can view invoices (and also edit invoices???)
Steps: Step 1: SetupThe Accounts Payable security policy contains the security right for CreateInvoice. Assign Grant or Deny rights as per the testing condition. || Step 2: Users with CreateInvoice rightsLaunch AccountsPayable as a user with rights to create invoices.Go to the Invoice tab and click on the button | Expected: The new invoice form is displayed || Step 3: Fill out the minimum fields and save the invoice.Search for the invoice at the Invoice list grid | Expected: Invoice is saved successfully.Searching for the Invoice returns the invoice in the Invoice list grid. || Step 4: Users without CreateInvoice rightsLaunch AccountsPayable as a user without rights to create invoices.Go to the Invoice tab | Expected: The New Invoice button is disabled || Step 6: Go to Security Manager, in Module Policies Tab >Accounts Payable > tick CreateInvoice.Save || Step 7: Open AP, Create New invoice from Ribbon | Expected: A new invoice entry screen is created. || Step 8: Fill in the details and click Save | Expected: Invoice created and saved into table APT_INVOICE || Step 9: Back to Security Manager, untick CreateInvoice and Save. || Step 10: Reopen AP, Create New invoice from Ribbon | Expected: Ribbon disabledIf Ribbon is not disabled, all field in invoice entry screen should be disabled.

Title: Accounts Payable - Invoices - Electronically acquired invoices without vendor codes are saved correctly to APT_INVOICE and APS_INVOICE_Z
Description:
We focus on making sure when an invalid (or none) vendor code is entered, the invoice is still saved correctly.
 
Invoices with temporary vendor codes can still be saved; when the user views the invoice on the invoice form, they will need to create a valid new vendor; see Dave's notes below:
 
Validation of temp vendor names - We do not need to run any special validation against temporary names, as these will not be used as the eventual vendor name in Expert. The process will be that if an invoice is received with a temporary vendor name, it will display in the invoice list screen with a warning indicating that it is a temporary vendor. The user ( or someone else ) will have to set up a real vendor for this invoice, which will do any validation and reconciliation of vendor names etc. The user will then select the correct vendor for the invoice, the correct vendor name will be used, and the temporary vendor name will be removed – but none of this has been done yet.
 
When we do the end-to-end testing for electronic invoices, this is part of what we need to check.
 
For the end-to-end electronic invoice save check:
- Check tables: header created in APS_INVOICE_Z and APT_INVOICE
- Check the defaulting has occured in this case where no valid vendor codes were supplied, but a temporary vendor code is supplied
- Check the GL and disb detail lines have been saved
- On the invoice form, check the temp vendor name has been flagged, and user is prompted to create a new vendor.
 
Useful SQL:
 
select *
from APS_INVOICE_Z
where SESSION in
(select session
from APT_INVOICE
where INVOICE_DATE > CURRENT_TIMESTAMP)
select CURRENCY_CODE,BOOK,APTYPE_CODE,DISCTERM_CODE,TEN99_CODE,SEPARATE_CHECK,HOLD_TAX,BILL_PMT_REQD,DISC_DATE,DUE_DATE,TEN99_AMT,DISC_AMT,JURISDIC_CODE,TAX_IN,APPROVED,TAX_REPORT_STAT,
TRAN_UNO,SESSION,INVOICE_STATUS,BANK_UNO,SCHEDULE_NUM,PERIOD,GL_AUDIT_NUM,LATEST_DATE,LATEST_PERIOD,DRUNO,USE_OVERRIDE,ADDRESS_UNO,USE_NAME_OVERRIDE,USE_ADDRS_OVERRIDE, *
from APT_INVOICE
where INVOICE_DATE > CURRENT_TIMESTAMP

Title: Accounts Payable - Invoices - Electronically acquired invoices that are missing required information are not saved, and error messages are generated in this case
Description:
Check that under the conditions where the minimal amount of data required to save an invoice is not met, error messages are generated in this case and saved somewhere.
 
According to the following series inputs (in attached spreadsheet), we expect certain outcomes; as the API is expanded, we will need to also expand the range of inputs to ensure the right messages are coming through (or if required data is missing, we show the expected error messages)
 
Also as we develop the OCR capability, we should no longer need to push data via the API and instead run end-to-end from OCR to application.
 
Error messages should be populated to APT_MESSAGE:
 
select *
from APT_MESSAGE
order by LAST_MODIFIED desc

Title: Accounts Payable - Invoices - Electronically acquired invoices with vendor codes will default data differently, depending on AddDefaultInfo setting on the service API
Description:
Check that the defaulting fields are behaving differently depending on whether the AddDefaultInfo flag is on or not.
 
There are two scenarios, assuming that a valid vendor code has been provided with the invoice:
- When AddDefaultInfo flag is turned on
- When the AddDefaultInfo flag is turned off
 
The following SQL selects all fields that are to be defaulted
The first line looks at fields that will be defaulted regardless of the AddDefaultInfo flag
The second line looks at fields that are only defaulted if the AddDefaultInfo flag is turned ON
 
select CURRENCY_CODE,BOOK, TEN99_AMT,JURISDIC_CODE,TAX_IN,APPROVED,TAX_REPORT_STAT,TRAN_UNO,SESSION,INVOICE_STATUS,BANK_UNO,SCHEDULE_NUM,PERIOD,GL_AUDIT_NUM,LATEST_DATE,LATEST_PERIOD,DRUNO,USE_OVERRIDE,ADDRESS_UNO,USE_NAME_OVERRIDE,USE_ADDRS_OVERRIDE,
APTYPE_CODE,DISCTERM_CODE,TEN99_CODE,SEPARATE_CHECK,HOLD_TAX,BILL_PMT_REQD,DISC_DATE,DUE_DATE,DISC_AMT,* --this line of columns will depend on the defaulting flag (AddDefaultInfo)
from APT_INVOICE
where INVOICE_DATE > CURRENT_TIMESTAMP
 
Testing approach
 
We will use valid vendor codes (with different settings) and check the correct settings are defaulted...
- Similar to how we're testing vendor defaulting on the invoice form, with regards to the payment terms etc. We would expect similar calculations to happen here for the invoice defaulting
- Are there other things we need to watch out for?

Title: Accounts Payable - How new AP handle Session in background when create new invoice
Description: By having Session to populate automatically for new invoices for new AP, Classic AP could also open the invoice too.
Steps: Step 1: Create an new invoice in new AP and save.Note the invoice number. | Expected: Check APT_INVOICE table if invoice is created. The Session column in the table should be populated automatically even though it is not visible in the application. Note the Session ID || Step 2: Open the created invoice from Session window (AP > Invoice Entry) using the Session ID | Expected: old AP should be able to fetch the invoice you created. || Step 3: Double click on your invoice. Your invoice should be in Invoice Entry window | Expected: Invoice entry form pop up. Check if the details are consistent with what you entered in new AP. || Step 4: In old AP, create two invoices. | Expected: You will have to go through the Session screen in old AP to create new invoices. Note your invoice numbers. Session ID for these two invoices should be identical. || Step 5: open the invoices created in old AP in new AP using invoice number | Expected: new AP should be able to fetch the invoice you created. Check if details are consistent with what you entered in old AP. || Step 6: Create two invoices in new AP and check their Session IDs. | Expected: Each invoices created in new AP have their own Session ID.

Title: Accounts Payable - Create another invoice while current invoice is not saved / Working on multiple invoices at a time
Description:
There are times when AP cleark got distracted on some other urgent tasks, in this case, an invoice which needed to be key into system urgently.
It is important for the system to not lose the current invoice even when working on the other ones.
 
User should be prompted to save if he/she closes the application as there is a chance they might forgotten the tasks they left behind.
 
This function should be available across the application.
Steps: Step 1: Open new AP, create a new invoice A.Create another new invoice B. | Expected: Invoice A and B created successfully || Step 2: Navigate Invoice A and B back and forth. || Step 3: Start putting information into the invoice A. || Step 4: Without saving Invoice A, and start putting in information into Invoice B too. || Step 5: When finish filling in Invoice B, navigate back to Invoice A | Expected: Everything you filled into Invoice A remains unchanged and should not be gone too.

Title: AP Admin - AP Setup - Check Formats cannot be deleted if banks are using it

Check with table TBM_FMT_CH if it has been added to database. || Step 2: Assign Bank to created Check Format For now, we only have access to Classic > Hub Setup > Time and Billing Setup > Banks. *To update when we have Hub Setup in Admin App*Select any existing bank (eg, BOT) and tab out. Attach TESTFMT for Check Format field.Hit Ok.Check with SQL (assume that you are using BOT) :select format_code as FormatCode from TBM_FMT_CH a left join TBM_BANK b on b.CH_FORMAT_UNO = a.FORMAT_UNO where b.BANK_CODE = 'BOT' | Expected: SQL Result: TESTFMT || Step 3: Now back to Check Format in Admin App.Select TESTFMT from the list of format and delete it by clicking the 'X'. | Expected: Delete Error dialog pop up, showing which bank is using this format. || Step 4: Hit Ok on the error dialog. | Expected: Check format is not deleted. || Step 5: Assign your Check Format to more bank then try to delete it (Check Format) again. | Expected: A list of banks which you assigned the format to will be showing on the dialog.Check format is not deleted. || Step 6: Unassign this Check Format to all the banks you assigned on previous steps. || Step 7: Now delete the check format in Admin App. Hit Yes. Save | Expected: Prompted to confirm to delete this check format.

Title: Payment - Vendor: Default address (Pre 822.EX0006)
Description:
The default address display in the payment screen for vendor payment should be as follow
 
Quote Dave's: 

For a Vendor Payment ( as opposed to Employee, Client or Misc ) we should first look for an Address_Uno on APM_Vendor and use that. 
If one is not present on APM_Vendor ( i.e. the uno is 0 ) then we look for the Address_Uno on the HBM_Name record for the Vendor ( i.e. where vendor.Name_Uno = name.Name_Uno ). 
If that address_Uno is also 0, then we look for the first address that we can find that is attached to the name record ( ie. from HBM_Address where address.Name_Uno = name.Name_Uno )
 
Since the search hiearchy is APM_vendor > hbm_name > hbm_address, we will test this from the lowest hierachy for minimal setup required.
Steps: Step 1: Data pre reqsNote: Make sure the default addresses you set are not the first addresses so you know you're not just getting back the first address in the list-Name record is the vendor- Vendor default is the remittance addressVendor 1- Name record has multiple addresses- Name record has default address- Vendor record has different default address Vendor 2- Name record has multiple addresses- Name record has default address- Vendor record does not have default address Vendor 3- Name record has multiple addresses- Name record does not have default address- Vendor record has default addressVendor 4- Name record has multiple addresses- Name record does not have default address- Vendor record does not have default addressSELECT''[Vendor Name Addresses],v.VENDOR_ID,n.NAME,CASEWHEN v.ADDRESS_UNO = a.ADDRESS_UNO Then'Y'ELSE'N'END [Ven Addr Default],CASEWHEN n.ADDRESS_UNO = a.ADDRESS_UNO Then'Y'ELSE'N'END [Name Addr Default],a.ADDRESS1,a.ADDRESS2,a.ADDRESS3,a.ADDRESS4,a.CITY,a.STATE_CODE,a.COUNTY,a.REGION_CODE,a.COUNTRY_CODE,a.ADDRESS_CODE, a.ADDRESS_UNO,a.NAME_UNO,v.VENDOR_UNOFROM HBM_ADDRESS aJOIN HBM_NAME n ON a.NAME_UNO = n.NAME_UNOJOIN APM_VENDOR v ON n.NAME_UNO = v.NAME_UNOWHERE a.ADDRESS_UNO <> 0 --AND VENDOR_ID = 'JANA1'ORDERBY v.VENDOR_ID || Step 2: Vendor and Name have default addressCreate vendor payment- use vendor 1SELECT ''[Different Default Vendor and Name address],v.VENDOR_ID,v.VENDOR_NAME,NAME,v.ADDRESS_UNO[Vendor default address],n.ADDRESS_UNO[Name default address] FROM APM_VENDOR vJOIN HBM_NAME n ON v.NAME_UNO = n.NAME_UNOWHERE v.ADDRESS_UNO > 0AND n.ADDRESS_UNO > 0AND v.ADDRESS_UNO <> n.ADDRESS_UNO | Expected: Address set from Vendor default || Step 3: Only Name has address defaultCreate vendor payment- use vendor 2SELECT ''[Default Name address only],v.VENDOR_ID,v.VENDOR_NAME,NAME,n.ADDRESS_UNO[Name default address] FROM APM_VENDOR vJOIN HBM_NAME n ON v.NAME_UNO = n.NAME_UNOWHERE v.ADDRESS_UNO = 0AND n.ADDRESS_UNO > 0 | Expected: Address set from Name default || Step 4: Only Vendor has address defaultCreate vendor payment- use vendor 3SELECT ''[Default Vendor address only],v.VENDOR_ID,v.VENDOR_NAME,NAME,v.ADDRESS_UNO [Vendor default address]FROM APM_VENDOR vJOIN HBM_NAME n ON v.NAME_UNO = n.NAME_UNOWHERE v.ADDRESS_UNO > 0AND n.ADDRESS_UNO = 0 | Expected: Address set from Vendor default || Step 5: No defaultsCreate a vendor payment- use vendor 4 | Expected: Address set from first one found (this could be a bit random)Note: Address not set in classic

Title: Payment Schedule List - Checking the Advanced Search filter list
Description:
This test case is to make sure the search filters works as expected. Only basic searches is tested.
Cut off date is obsolete.
Steps: Step 1: Follow Step 2 to create an posted payment schedule. || Step 2: Checking Schedule No filter = %ScheduleNo%- a search control, looking up aps_schedule_z | Expected: Created schedule is listed in search result || Step 3: Checking Schedule Type filter = V- list control, Employee or Vendor option only | Expected: Created schedule is listed in search result || Step 4: Checking Created By filter = %you%- search control, return result from HBM_PERSNL | Expected: Created schedule is listed in search result || Step 5: Checking Created Date filter = current date- a date provider, default to current date | Expected: Created schedule is listed in search result || Step 6: Checking Bank filter = BOT- list control, all bank from TBM_BANK, active and inactive | Expected: Created schedule is listed in search result || Step 7: Checking Status filter = P- list control, Request generate or Edit option only | Expected: Created schedule is listed in search result || Step 8: Checking Payment Date filter = current date- Date provider | Expected: Created schedule is listed in search result || Step 9: Checking Date To Print filter = current date- Date provider | Expected: Created schedule is listed in search result || Step 10: Checking Edit Printed filter = No- list control, yes or no option only. | Expected: Created schedule is listed in search result || Step 11: Checking Take Discount filter = No- list control , yes or no option only | Expected: Created schedule is listed in search result || Step 12: Checking Language filter = English- List control, all available languages from HBL_LANGUAGE | Expected: Created schedule is listed in search result || Step 13: Checking Last Modified filter = current date- date provider. | Expected: Created schedule is listed in search result

Title: Accounts Payable - Smoke Test (Read Summary before testing)
Description:
This is AP smoke test which covers (as in 23/05/2016)

Setting up environment for license, printer, date
vendor, assign vendor group 
Create and post invoice
Paying invoice
Checking invoice status hover
Closing an unsaved work
 recognise when you last close it
payment schedule
Quick check
Steps: Step 1: Go to Step 2 for instruction on how to - Import license- Set up Printer (necessary for check printing)- Set up Date parameter || Step 2: Set up new Vendor (to include Related Payee and Vendor Group)a. Go to Vendors section tab in new AP.b. Click New Vendor ribbon to create a new vendor then fill in details as followVendor Code: 1234 (or any unused code)Reporting Name: AP Smoke Test || Step 3: Create a new Invoicea. Click the 'New Invoice' ribbon from the Invoices Tabb. In New Invoice Tab, fill these in:Vendor: 2000Invoice Number: SmokeTestInvoice Date: Current DateAmount: 1500 USDBook: Firm - Master BookPayment Term: 2% 10, Net30Reference: SmokeInvoiceNarrative: This is narrative1099 Type : INT1099 Amount: 200in Detail column, click Add New.In the G/L Detail window, fill in as followingAccount: 31009Office: AUKDepartment: ADMAmount: 1500Jurisdiction: GSTProfit Center: Default profit centerNarrative: Narrative in G\L DetailSave and CloseFrom the Invoice List, locate your created invoice and release it. || Step 4: Payment scheduleGo to Payment Scheule Tab, click Create New ribbon. Fill inBank: || Step 5: Checking invoice status hoverNow back to Invoice List screen. Key in the search criteria and locate your invoice.Hover to 'i' icon beside Invoice status. | Expected: Your invoice status should be Settled. Hover to the icon will display the payment details you made. || Step 6: Closing an unsaved workCreate New invoice and fill in the required fields.Go to Payment Section Tab, Create New Vendor Payment, fill in the required fields.Without Save, close the application. | Expected: Dialog showing unsaved Payment and options with Save, Cancel and Discard.After clicking one of the options, the same dialog box will appear again, this time for the unsaved Invoice. || Step 7: Recognise the state when you last closed itSwitch the columns around, add or remove the advanced search fields. Close and reopen the application. | Expected: Changes made on the position still retained after reopen the application. || Step 8: Quick CheckPaying Invoicea. In Payments section tab, click New Payment then Vendor Paymentb. Fill in as followVendor: AP Smoke TestPayment Method: Manual CheckPayment Date: Current DateAmount: 1500Check Number: %AnyNumber%c. Tab out and hit Saved. Click Invoice Payment in details tab, then click Add New.e. Locate the invoice by typing in the invoice number: SmokeTest

(8240 release) || Step 3: Saved Search.Make sure searches are able to saved, delete and edit. Title: Accounts Payable - Payment Entry - Saving a Vendor, Client, Employee and Miscellaneous payment with only required fields
Description: This test is to check if we allow payment being saved when only required fields are being filled in the four different Payment screen.
Steps: Step 1: Open new AP application, in Payments Section Tab.Click New Payment in ribbon bar then Vendor Payment. | Expected: A new payment entry form appear along with a new tab on top of ribbon bar displaying 'Payment (New)' || Step 2: In the new form ,there are four required fields which has orange outline. || Step 3: Fill these fields in. | Expected: By filling in the Vendor, Bank will also be filled automatically. Bank is default to the AP_TYPE attached to Vendor  being selected on first time. It will not change any when you change to another Vendor again.For example, a Vendor is tied to Bank of Tallahassee (BOT), by selecting this vendor will default Bank to BOT. If change to another vendor (which tied to Bank of US), the Bank field will still remain as BOT. || Step 4: If you choose Manual Check as Payment method, a new required field, Check Number will be available.Fill it with any number. || Step 5: Now save it | Expected: The tab title will display 'Payment(RequestNumber)'.Confirm if it has been saved to APT_CHECK and display the correct RequestNumber. It should have Not Posted (N) status and not allowed to Release or Post this payment yet. || Step 6: Hover to the right upper corner for Payment Details hover. | Expected: It should display a yellow flag with 'U' wording. A window will display the payment details when you hover over it. The details displaying are:-  Request Number- Status- Check Printed- Created By- Created Date || Step 7: Repeat step 1-6 for Client Payment || Step 8: Repeat step 1-6 for Employee Payment || Step 9: Repeat step 1-6 for Miscellaneous Payment

Title: Accounts Payable - Vendor Payment Entry - Checking the validation and rules for fields in Vendor Payment Entry screen
Description:
This test case outline the steps taken to check all the fields in Vendor payment entry screen. 
They are based on Dave document, check the document if you need more details on the rules and validation.
Steps: Step 1: Merged this info into look and feel test || Step 2: Open new AP > Payment section tab > New Payment > Vendor Payment || Step 3: Vendor- Select any vendor from this field.- Then go to appshell > AP > AP setup > Vendor- key in the vendor ID and tick the Inactive box. Close.- Select the same vendor ID which you deactived in new AP. - Now reactive the vendor. | Expected: Inactive Vendor does not show in this field. || Step 4: Payee Name and Address- Select any vendor in Vendor field. | Expected: This will show vendor's address in default. You can only edit the address from the blue 'Modify Address' but only to the address of related payee. || Step 5: Payment Method- only has Check C, Manual M, Electronic E and Wire W || Step 6: Check Numberthis field affect by the value in Payment Method. | Expected: When select Check, Check number field will be disabled for read only. If select Manual, Check number field is enabled, user can enter any check number.If select Electronic or Wire, Check number field will be hidden || Step 7: Payment Date- In appshell > AP > AP setup > Parameters. Check the Max and Min allowable transaction date.- Select a date within the Max and Min trans date.- Select a date which falls out of Max and Min trans date.- Manually type in a date which falls out of Max and Min trans date. | Expected: Only date which falls into Max and Min trans date is allowed. User is unable to select date outside of Max and Min trans date using the calender. if user manually change it to date outside of Max and Min trans date, user will be warn with red exclaimation mark and issue details when hover to it. Invoice saves will also be disabled. || Step 8: Date to Print- Change payment method to E and M - Change payment method to C, notice the difference in this field when switching payment method.- Enter yesterday's date- Enter today's date.- Enter tomorrow's date.- Enter next week date. | Expected: This field is only enabled when payment method = C.Entered date must be larger or equal to today. || Step 9: Amount- Insert any amount into the field- hover to the inserted amount | Expected: the hover should display the amount in words. (300 for three hundred etc.) || Step 10: Currency- This field is always disabled. - Note the currency being used here.- Change to different currency by changing the AP Type code with CAD currency in vendor setup (classic)- Now go back to to the payment entry screen. and check if currency is changed. | Expected: Currecy is affected by the Bank that is selected in payment || Step 11: Spot Rate - Suppose your system currency is USD, Select bank which also uses USD.-Now change to bank which uses CAD. | Expected: Only appear when bank currency is dfferent to system currency. || Step 12: Bank- Check if this field is defaulted to the bank of selected vendor.- Change to any vendor. | Expected: This field is automatically populated to Bank defaulted to selected vendor but only for the first time when a vendor is selected. || Step 13: Book- || Step 14: Requested by - Change to another user | Expected: Defaulted to the one who create payment but can also be change if desired. || Step 15: Jurisdiction- In CMS_Option table, set 'Y' for Taxes_In_Use- Check the Juridisction field in AP- Set 'N' for Taxes_In_use- Check the Juridisction field in AP again | Expected: This line should default from selected vendor.This field is gone when Taxes_In_use = N. || Step 16: 1099 Type- In CMS_Option table, set 'Y' for 1099_In_Use- Check the 1099 Type field in AP- Set 'N' for 1099_In_Use- Check the 1099 Type field in AP again | Expected: This line should default from selected vendor.This field is gone when 1099_In_use = N. || Step 17: Reference - Type in anything.- Don't type in anything at all. | Expected: This field is not required and not default from anything. || Step 18: Language- Change to French in Vendor Setup | Expected: Same with Currency field, it is defaulted from Vendor. So it should appear as French in the field when changed the Language value in Vendor setup. || Step 19: Tax Include | Expected: This field is defaulted from the same field in AP Parrameters || Step 20: 1099 Amount- In CMS_Option table, set 'Y' for 1099_In_Use- Check the 1099 Type field in AP- Set 'N' for 1099_In_Use- Check the 1099 Type field in AP again | Expected: Default to check amount.This field is gone when 1099 is not in use. || Step 21: Image Reference- more design required. || Step 22: Sales use Tax- In CMS_Option table, set 'Y' for sales_use_tx- Enter any value into the field. | Expected: This field only appear when set Y for sales_use_tx.Only numbers are allowed to enter into this field. || Step 23: Recoverable Tax- In APM_PARM, set 'Y' for Recov_cont_reqd or tick Recoverable Tax Control Reqd in AP Paramaters (Classic)- Enter total of tax- Enter tax for invoices. | Expected: This field is set as control for sum of tax lines.,*to be test when we can release/post' || Step 24: 1099 Total- Add two details line which have 300 and 200 as their 1099 amount. | Expected: This field is not available to edit. It is the sum total of 1099 amount in detail lines. So it should be 500. || Step 25: Narrative- Type in anything. | Expected: Can input any symbols, characters and numbers. || Step 26: Bank Details- edit and add in any details to be show on your eletronic banking record.- 14/2/2018 can no longer edit details- read only and used for Electronic Banking (E) only | Expected: Can input any symbols, characters and numbers. Default from account details for payee in HBM_name_bank

Title: Accounts Payable - Vendor Payment Entry -Invoice Payment - Paying an invoice using different bank but has same company code.
Description:
This is to check Bank on APtype_code for invoice and bank selected for payment are both attached to the same company. 
 
Unlike Test case 1445553, this test case is to make sure new AP still allow payment when paying an invoice using different bank with same company code.
Steps: Step 1: Covered under invoice tests || Step 2: Prerequisite- Bank A for TLH office- another Bank B for TLH office- AP type for Bank A - a GL invoice from vendor A with Bank A || Step 3: Run attached conversion script. | Expected: Invoice is now converted to new Expert status: Outstanding || Step 4: When you already have all the listed stuffs above, go to Vendor Payment page to pay the invoice. || Step 5: Key in the Vendor A. | Expected: Bank defaulted to Bank A. || Step 6: Fill in the rest of the form then click Save | Expected: Details panel buttons are enabled. || Step 7: In Invoice Payment Details Tab, click 'Add New'. Type in the GL invoice you created and select it. Click Ok | Expected: Invoice added succesfully || Step 8: Now remove it || Step 9: Change Bank to Bank B || Step 10: Select the GL Invoice again. | Expected: Invoice added succesfully. As long as the bank for payment has the same office as invoice AP Type, making payment is allowed.

Title: Accounts Payable - Vendor Payment Entry - Attach an invoice whose bank has a different bank office for payment
Payment Items - Invoice: payment date is before invoice hold date.
Description: It is not usual to pay an invoice before hold date but is possible. If user still choose to make payment before the hold date, a warning is given.
Steps: Step 1: Create an invoice with hold date greater than current date using Appshell. || Step 2: Run the attached SQL Script. || Step 3: in New AP, go to Payments section tab and create new  Vendor payment. || Step 4: Fill in the vendor payment form as desired then Save. | Expected: Buttons in Details column are enabled. || Step 5: Click 'Add New' and select the invoice you created in Step 1. | Expected: you will be have a warning message which indicate 'Today's date is less than the hold date. Do you want to continue this transaction?'. || Step 6: if click OK | Expected: Invoice is added to the payment || Step 7: if click Cancel | Expected: Invoice is not added to the payment || Step 8: Repeat with payment date = hold date and payment date > hold date for verification. | Expected: User will not be prompted with warning message for this two criterias.

Title: Accounts Payable - Vendor Payment Entry - Pay partially paid invoice which require client to pay for disbursement first before we can pay (Bill_Pyt_Reqd = Y)
Description:
Bill_Pyt_Reqd column stores if client must pay the bill for the disdbursement before law firm pays the supplier.
When Bill_Pyt_Reqd = Y, and the invoice already partially paid, then allow payment.
 
Hence we should test on paying invoice for
- partially paid invoice, Bill_Pyt_Reqd = Y, can pay
- full paid invoice, Bill_Pyt_Reqd = Y, fully paid so can't pay
- Not paid invoice, Bill_Pyt_Reqd = Y, can't pay
Steps: Step 1: read summary, still designing steps.

Title: Accounts Payable - Vendor Payment Entry - Paying an disbursement invoice which Client Bill Pmt Reqd is set to True but no payment paid by client yet.
Description:
Bill_Pyt_Reqd column stores if client must pay the bill for the disdbursement before law firm pays the supplier.
When Bill_Pyt_Reqd = Y, and the invoice amount < 0 (credit), then allow payment.
 
- Invoice amount < 0, Bill_Pyt_Reqd = Y, can pay
- Invoice amount = 0, Bill_Pyt_Reqd = Y, cannot pay
- Invoice amount > 0, Bill_Pyt_Reqd = Y, cannot pay
 
Note that this is for only for invoice with disbursement detail line.
Steps: Step 1: Create an disbursement invoice. Also tick the Client Bill Pmt Req'd check box || Step 2: Pay it using the Vendor payment forms. | Expected: Not successful because it it not paid by client yet.

Title: Accounts Payable - Payment Entry - Checking the Payment status hover.
Description:
This test case outline steps taken to ensure the payment status hover in payment entry screen have been properly implemented.
This test assume that each type of payments entry screen uses the same algorithm, which mean they should behaves the same across different payment types.
Steps: Step 1: Be sure to run the payment status conversion script everytime a new payment is created. The script is at Dev\AP\Modules\Database\Src\Database\Scripts\Post-Deployment\APT_CHECK_expert_payment_status.sql || Step 2: In New AP, go to Payments section Tab and locate the unposted check and posted check you created. Open them. || Step 3: Hover over to the upper right corner of unposted check, which should have an orange triangle flag with 'U' indicate Unposted status. | Expected: The hover panel should display - Request Number - Status- Check Printed - Created by (will not populate if payment is made from appshell) || Step 4: Hover over to the upper right corner of posted check, which should have an green triangle flag with 'P' indicate Posted status. | Expected: The hover panel should display - Request Number - Status- Check Printed - Created by (will not populate if payment is made from appshell) || Step 5: Post a manual check in appshell and check the hover in new AP. | Expected: The hover panel should display- Request Number- Status- Check Printed - Created by (will not populate if payment is made from appshell) || Step 6: Locate the posted direct credit in new AP || Step 7: Hover over to the upper right corner of posted direct credit, which should have an green triangle flag with 'P' indicate Posted status. | Expected: The hover panel should display- Request Number - Status- Bank File Created: Yes (if you follow through Step 5)- Created by

Title: Accounts Payable - Payment Entry Form - Test the behaviour of Check/Wire Number field, checking if it is using a valid check/wire number
Steps: Step 1: Open New AP, go to Payments Section Tab.Create new payment by clicking the New button on the ribbon. | Expected: A new payment entry form created. || Step 2: Select any desired vendor. | Expected: The address and payment details will be populate automatically. || Step 3: Select Check as Payment Method | Expected: Check Number field will become disabled and read only. || Step 4: Complete the form until you can print the check, then proceed to print the check. | Expected: The next registered and available check number will be assigned and display in the field. || Step 5: Create another new payment entry form, this time with Manual Check as Payment Method. | Expected: Check Number field will be enabled for you to enter any number, it is one of the required fields. || Step 6: Enter a registered and available Check Number. You can find out which numbers are available in appshell > AP > Check Number Registration. || Step 7: Enter an unregistered Check Number | Expected: Get error that this check is not available || Step 8: Enter a voided Check Number | Expected: Get error that this check voided and cannot be used. || Step 9: Re-enter the valid Check Number and complete the form until you can print the check. Print the check when done. || Step 10: Create another new payment entry form, now with Wire Transfer as Payment Method. | Expected: Check/Wire Number field will be gone. || Step 11: Open AppShell > Hub Setup > Time and Billing Setup > Banks.Enter the Bank which your vendor used for payment then tab out. || Step 12: Tick the 'Wire Number Required' field. Save. || Step 13: Back to new AP with a new payment entry form. Fill in the Vendor whose Bank you made changes just now. Set Wire Transfer as Payment method again. | Expected: Wire Number field appear as required field and will run validation if entered wire number is valid. || Step 14: Tick the 'Auto Wire Number' in Banks setup in appshell too. Check how does Wire Number field behaves now. | Expected: Wire Number will be disabled but not gone. It will be Read only. Once a payment is saved, a valid wire number will be assigned and display here. || Step 15: Make sure to untick these two fields after testing.

Title: Accounts Payable - Vendor Payment Entry - Paying an invoice to vendor using Check, Manual Check and Electronic Banking
Steps: Step 1: For ideal testing result, it is best to create the invoice which we will be paying using new AP. We will still continue to use appshell to create new invoice until the Invoices Entry is being implement in new AP. || Step 2: Create a new invoice in appshell for any desired vendor. || Step 3: Now in new AP, go to Payments section tab. Select new Vendor Payment. | Expected: A new payment entry form will pop up. || Step 4: Fill in the payment entry form. Make sure to have Payment Method set as Check. | Expected: The Check Number will be disabled. || Step 5: Fill in all the payment header then hit Save. | Expected: Buttons in Details pane will be enabled. You will be assigned an available and registered Check Number. || Step 6: Go to Invoice Payment details pane. Click Add. | Expected: An invoice selection window will appear. || Step 7: Enter the invoice number. | Expected: It will run validation as soon as you select your invoice. If you select an invoice number which already on payment run, you will not be allowed to save and will be prompted with warning. || Step 8: Now key in the invoice amount so that it matches the payment amount. | Expected: You will not be able to make payment if the total invoice amount does not matches the payment amount. || Step 9: When you are ready with paying the amount. Release it for payment Run by pressing the Release button. Or you can click Print to print the check. | Expected: Check is print.

Title: Accounts Payable - Vendor Payment Entry - Invoice Payment - Paying an invoice using bank with different company code. IS THIS VALID?
Description:
To be tested on the new Invoice payment details. 
 
An invoice aptype code (which also carry the info of bank of the office) should be the the same with the office code of the bank used for payment.
 
In this test case, we tested if the new AP also holds the same validation as classic, by trying to select invoice with bank with different company code.
Steps: Step 1: To test this, you should have- a bank BAP1 for TLH office- a bank BAP2 for AUK office (or any office other than TLH)- an AP Type 1 for TLH office- a vendor VAP1 for TLH office- a GL invoice from vendor VAP1 with APType 1 || Step 2: Run attached conversion script. | Expected: Invoice is now converted to new Expert status: Outstanding || Step 3: When you already have all the listed stuffs above, go to Vendor Payment page to pay the invoice. || Step 4: Key in the Vendor VAP1. | Expected: Bank defaulted to Bank BAP1 || Step 5: Fill in the rest of the form then click Save | Expected: Details panel buttons are enabled. || Step 6: In Invoice Payment Details Tab, click 'Add New'. Type in the GL invoice you created and select it. Click Ok | Expected: Invoice added succesfully || Step 7: Now remove it || Step 8: Change to Bank to BAP2. || Step 9: Select the GL invoice again. | Expected: Prompted by error message of "The invoice belong to a different company from which the bank is being written"

Title: Payment Schedule Entry - Unsaved payment schedule header
Description: Since the application picks up the next available payment schedule number whenever a new one is created, it is important to check that the unsaved new schedule does not get saved too.
Steps: Step 1: Open new AP and create new payment schedules | Expected: The new schedule will be assigned with the next available schedule number || Step 2: Fill in the header and save the schedule. Check APS_SCHEDULE_Z | Expected: Schedule is saved || Step 3: Create another new schedule | Expected: New schedule will be assigned with the next available schedule number || Step 4: Check APS_SCHEDULE_Z | Expected: A row has been created for this new,unsaved schedule.djo - updated this. A row is not created in APS_Schedule_Z until the schedule header is saved. || Step 5: Close without saving the new schedule and check the table again. | Expected: Row deleted

Title: Testing the RibbonButtonDropDown dialog layout in AP build Dev.AP.BuildAll_20160620.2 on various Expert Product
