(300 for three hundred etc.) || Step 23: Currency- This field is always disabled. - Note the currency being used here.- Change to different currency by changing the AP Type code with CAD currency in vendor setup (classic)- Now go back to to the payment entry screen. and check if currency is changed. | Expected: Currecy is affected by the Bank that is selected in payment || Step 24: Spot Rate - Suppose your system currency is USD, Select bank which also uses USD.-Now change to bank which uses CAD. | Expected: Only appear when bank currency is dfferent to system currency. || Step 25: Bank- Check if this field is defaulted to the bank of selected vendor.- Change to any vendor. | Expected: This field is automatically populated to Bank defaulted to selected vendor but only for the first time when a vendor is selected.It should not be defaulted to an inactive bankSELECT v.VENDOR_ID,v.VENDOR_NAME,v.APTYPE_CODE,typ.BANK_CODEFROM APM_VENDOR vJOIN APL_APTYPE typ ON v.APTYPE_CODE = typ.APTYPE_CODEJOIN TBM_BANK b ON typ.BANK_CODE = b.BANK_CODEWHERE v.VENDOR_ID = 'tst1' || Step 26: Requested by - Type in anything.- Don't type in anything at all. | Expected: This field is not required and not default from anything. || Step 30: Language- Change to French in Vendor Setup | Expected: Same with Currency field, it is defaulted from Vendor. So it should appear as French in the field when changed the Language value in Vendor setup. || Step 31: Tax Include | Expected: This field is defaulted from the same field in AP Parrameters || Step 32: 1099 Amount- In CMS_Option table, set 'Y' for 1099_In_Use- Check the 1099 Type field in AP- Set 'N' for 1099_In_Use- Check the 1099 Type field in AP again | Expected: Default to check amount.This field is gone when 1099 is not in use. || Step 33: Image Reference- more design required. || Step 34: Sales use Tax- In CMS_Option table, set 'Y' for sales_use_tx- Enter any value into the field. | Expected: This field only appear when set Y for sales_use_tx.Only numbers are allowed to enter into this field. || Step 35: Recoverable Tax- In APM_PARM, set 'Y' for Recov_cont_reqd or tick Recoverable Tax Control Reqd in AP Paramaters (Classic)- Enter total of tax- Enter tax for invoices. | Expected: This field is set as control for sum of tax lines.,*to be test when we can release/post' || Step 36: 1099 Total- Add two details line which have 300 and 200 as their 1099 amount. | Expected: This field is not available to edit. It is the sum total of 1099 amount in detail lines. So it should be 500. || Step 37: Narrative- Type in anything. | Expected: Can input any symbols, characters and numbers. || Step 38: Bank Details- edit and add in any details to be show on your eletronic banking record. | Expected: Can input any symbols, characters and numbers. Default from account details for payee in HBM_name_bank

Title: Schedule - Vendor: Taking overdue discount - Add Single
Steps: Step 1: Create Invoice with discount1. Create invoice- Enter mandatory data- Invoice date = today- Amount = 100- Select Payment Term '2%10' - add a line item to balance2. Post the Invoice | Expected: Invoice created with discount- Due date is 30 days > Invoice date- Discount date is 10 days > invoice date- Discount amount = 2.00 || Step 2: Take Overdue Discount = ON  Payment Date < Discount date 1. Create schedule- enter bank to match invoice- payment date = today- Date to print = today- Take Overdue Discount = Y2. Select to add single invoice3. Select the invoice and check the form values4. Close & Add | Expected: Invoice item added with discount appliedBug 251495 - Save button enabled on a invoice item form on payment schedule when no edits have been made - form appears to be dirtyAdd single Invoice form - middle sectionInvoice Amount = 100.00Discount Amount = 2.00Inv 1099 Amount = 100.00Balance = 100.00Add Single Invoice form - bottom sectionDiscount Amount = 2.00Payment Amount = 98.001099 Amount = 98.00Grid and Invoice item form displayInvoice Amount = 100.00Payment Amount = 98.00Discount Amount = 2.001099 Amount = 98.00APT_INVOICE_AMT (new  record)TRAN_TYPE = CHTC_AP_AMT = 100.00AP_AMT = 100.00TC_PAID_AMT = 98.00PAID_AMT = 98.00TEN99_AMT = 98.00DISCNT_AMT = 2.00----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Declarations ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------DECLARE @schedulenum asint= 26DECLARE @schbank asvarchar(50)= (SELECT BANK_CODE FROM APS_SCHEDULE_Z WHERE SCHEDULE_NUM = @schedulenum)DECLARE @company asvarchar(20)= (SELECT COMPANY_CODE FROM TBM_BANK b JOIN HBL_OFFICE o ON b.OFFC = o.OFFC_CODE WHERE b.BANK_CODE = @schbank)----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Header---------------------------------------------------------------------------------SELECT ''[APS_SCHEDULE_Z],SCHEDULE_NUM, z.STATUS,CASE WHEN z.SCHEDULE_TYPE = 'V' THEN 'Vendor' WHEN z.SCHEDULE_TYPE = 'E' THEN 'Employee' ELSE''END[Schedule Type],z.BANK_CODE,@company[Company],z.CHECK_DATE[Payment Date],z.DATE_TO_PRINT,cl.DISPLAY_TEXT [Language],----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Other fields---------------------------------------------------------------------------------z.CREATE_DATE,p.EMPLOYEE_NAME +' ('+ p.EMPLOYEE_CODE +')'[Created By],TAKE_DISCOUNT,z.EAP_INITIATED, z.CHECK_LANGUAGE,z.STATUS_DATE,p2.EMPLOYEE_NAME +' ('+ p2.EMPLOYEE_CODE +')'[Status Employee],z.STATUS_EMPL_UNO,z.CREATE_EMPL_UNO,z.CUTOFF_DATE,z.INACTIVE,z.PRIMARY_REGION,z.LAST_MODIFIED----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- From---------------------------------------------------------------------------------FROM APS_SCHEDULE_Z zLEFTJOIN HBM_PERSNL p ON z.CREATE_EMPL_UNO = p.EMPL_UNO -- created employee LEFTJOIN HBM_PERSNL p2 ON z.STATUS_EMPL_UNO = p2.EMPL_UNO -- status employee LEFTJOIN CXL_CODE_LOOKUP look1 ON z.STATUS= look1.DB_VALUE and look1.LOOKUP_GROUP ='PaymentScheduleStatus'JOIN CXL_CODE_LOOKUP cl on cl.DB_VALUE = z.CHECK_LANGUAGE and cl.LOOKUP_GROUP ='CheckLanguage'WHERE SCHEDULE_NUM = @schedulenum----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Schedule items---------------------------------------------------------------------------------SELECT ''[APT_INVOICE_AMT],ia.ROW_UNO,ia.INV_TRAN_UNO,SOURCE_REF,ia.TRAN_TYPE,v.VENDOR_NAME +' ('+ v.VENDOR_ID +')'[Vendor],v2.VENDOR_NAME +' ('+ v2.VENDOR_ID +')'[Remit Vendor],inv.INVOICE_NUM,inv.SEPARATE_CHECK,CASE WHEN inv.BANK_ACCOUNT_UNO = 0 THEN'Check'WHEN inv.BANK_ACCOUNT_UNO <> 0 THEN'Electronic Banking'END [Payment Method],inv.BANK_ACCOUNT_UNO,chq.WIRE_NUM,chq.CHECK_NUM,inv.INVOICE_DATE,inv.CURRENCY_CODE[Inv Cur],inv.TC_INV_AMT,inv.INV_AMT,ia.SIGN,ia.TC_CODE,ia.TC_PAID_AMT,ia.PAID_AMT,TC_AP_AMT,ia.AP_AMT,ia.TEN99_AMT,ia.DISCNT_AMT,inv.REF_NUM,ia.DISCNT_AMT, HOLD_DATE, ST_WHELD,inv.APTYPE_CODE,typ.BANK_CODE,inv.VENDOR_UNO,inv.REMIT_VENDOR_UNO,inv.EXPERT_INVOICE_STATUS, INVOICE_STATUS,inv.TRAN_UNO[TRAN_UNO Invoice],ia.LAST_MODIFIEDFROM APT_INVOICE_AMT iaJOIN APT_INVOICE inv on ia.INV_TRAN_UNO = inv.TRAN_UNOJOIN APL_APTYPE typ ON inv.APTYPE_CODE = typ.APTYPE_CODE LEFT JOIN APT_CHECK chq ON ia.SOURCE_TRAN_UNO = chq.TRAN_UNO LEFTJOIN APM_VENDOR v ON @schedulenum asint= 26DECLARE @schbank asvarchar(50)= (SELECT BANK_CODE FROM APS_SCHEDULE_Z WHERE SCHEDULE_NUM = @schedulenum)DECLARE @company asvarchar(20)= (SELECT COMPANY_CODE FROM TBM_BANK b JOIN HBL_OFFICE o ON b.OFFC = o.OFFC_CODE WHERE b.BANK_CODE = @schbank)----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Header---------------------------------------------------------------------------------SELECT ''[APS_SCHEDULE_Z],SCHEDULE_NUM, z.STATUS,CASE WHEN z.SCHEDULE_TYPE = 'V' THEN 'Vendor' WHEN z.SCHEDULE_TYPE = 'E' THEN 'Employee' ELSE''END[Schedule Type],z.BANK_CODE,@company[Company],z.CHECK_DATE[Payment Date],z.DATE_TO_PRINT,cl.DISPLAY_TEXT [Language],----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Other fields---------------------------------------------------------------------------------z.CREATE_DATE,p.EMPLOYEE_NAME +' ('+ p.EMPLOYEE_CODE +')'[Created By],TAKE_DISCOUNT,z.EAP_INITIATED, z.CHECK_LANGUAGE,z.STATUS_DATE,p2.EMPLOYEE_NAME +' ('+ p2.EMPLOYEE_CODE +')'[Status Employee],z.STATUS_EMPL_UNO,z.CREATE_EMPL_UNO,z.CUTOFF_DATE,z.INACTIVE,z.PRIMARY_REGION,z.LAST_MODIFIED----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- From---------------------------------------------------------------------------------FROM APS_SCHEDULE_Z zLEFTJOIN HBM_PERSNL p ON z.CREATE_EMPL_UNO = p.EMPL_UNO -- created employee LEFTJOIN HBM_PERSNL p2 ON z.STATUS_EMPL_UNO = p2.EMPL_UNO -- status employee LEFTJOIN CXL_CODE_LOOKUP look1 ON z.STATUS= look1.DB_VALUE and look1.LOOKUP_GROUP ='PaymentScheduleStatus'JOIN CXL_CODE_LOOKUP cl on cl.DB_VALUE = z.CHECK_LANGUAGE and cl.LOOKUP_GROUP ='CheckLanguage'WHERE SCHEDULE_NUM = @schedulenum----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Schedule items---------------------------------------------------------------------------------SELECT ''[APT_INVOICE_AMT],ia.ROW_UNO,ia.INV_TRAN_UNO,SOURCE_REF,ia.TRAN_TYPE,v.VENDOR_NAME +' ('+ v.VENDOR_ID +')'[Vendor],v2.VENDOR_NAME +' ('+ v2.VENDOR_ID +')'[Remit Vendor],inv.INVOICE_NUM,inv.SEPARATE_CHECK,CASE WHEN inv.BANK_ACCOUNT_UNO = 0 THEN'Check'WHEN inv.BANK_ACCOUNT_UNO <> 0 THEN'Electronic Banking'END [Payment Method],inv.BANK_ACCOUNT_UNO,chq.WIRE_NUM,chq.CHECK_NUM,inv.INVOICE_DATE,inv.CURRENCY_CODE[Inv Cur],inv.TC_INV_AMT,inv.INV_AMT,ia.SIGN,ia.TC_CODE,ia.TC_PAID_AMT,ia.PAID_AMT,ia.AP_AMT,inv.REF_NUM,DISC_DATE, DISC_AMT, HOLD_DATE, ST_WHELD,inv.APTYPE_CODE,typ.BANK_CODE,inv.VENDOR_UNO,inv.REMIT_VENDOR_UNO,inv.EXPERT_INVOICE_STATUS, INVOICE_STATUS,inv.TRAN_UNO[TRAN_UNO Invoice],ia.LAST_MODIFIEDFROM APT_INVOICE_AMT iaJOIN APT_INVOICE inv on ia.INV_TRAN_UNO = inv.TRAN_UNOJOIN APL_APTYPE typ ON inv.APTYPE_CODE = typ.APTYPE_CODE LEFT JOIN APT_CHECK chq ON ia.SOURCE_TRAN_UNO = chq.TRAN_UNO LEFTJOIN APM_VENDOR v ON inv.VENDOR_UNO = v.VENDOR_UNO -- vendor LEFTJOIN APM_VENDOR v2 ON inv.REMIT_VENDOR_UNO = v2.VENDOR_UNO -- remit vendor WHERE ia.SCHEDULE_NUM = @schedulenumAND TRAN_TYPE <>'CHX' || Step 7: Take Overdue Title: Schedule - Employee: Make sure invoice selection is still still as per design doc when Currency field is remove from the Add Multiple Invoices Screen
Area: ExpertSuite\Financials\Accounts Payable\Payment Schedule\Add to Schedule\Employee Invoices
Steps: Step 1: Make sure your employee's Exp AP Type is 'INV' || Step 2: Ensure that Currency of Expense Report (ER) / advance is the same as currency of selected bank. || Step 3: Create an ER and Advance from Expenses with USD Currency. Get them approved. || Step 4: Go to Moscow AP > Payment Schedules > Create new Employee Schedule.Fill in the header and click Save.Make sure your bank is not a USD Bank | Expected: Add Invoices ribbon enabled. || Step 5: Click Add Invoices ribbon > Add Multiple.Click Done so that it will return all item. | Expected: No payments found. || Step 6: Change to USD Bank on the header and do Step 4 again. | Expected: ER and Advance created in Step 2 returned. || Step 7: Ensure ER/Advance is approved. || Step 8: Have a few ER and advance in submit, cancel status. Try to retrieve them through the add multiple invoices screen. | Expected: Only APPROVED ER and Advance will be return. || Step 9: Ensure ER/Advance is not on a payment schedule || Step 10: Attached one of ER/advance to a payment schedule, check if it still return when perform the search/add. | Expected: Item already attached to other payment schedule will not be available. || Step 11: Ensure expense report is for the same company as the selected bank account. || Step 12: Change bank to 'BOP' which have Office = PNS. Add items into the schedule again. | Expected: Only USD Advance report will be added. || Step 13: Change the office of BOP bank from PNL to TLH.You can do that from Hub Setup > Time and Billing > Bank. || Step 14: Perform search again. | Expected: Both ER and Advance in USD will be return.

Title: AP: Exit from backstage
Steps: Step 1: Exit when no pending changes | Expected: * Application and process are closed || Step 2: Exit when pending changes are valid And Discard1. Open a record2. Edit the record with valid changes3. Select Exit from backstage4. On the Pending Changes window Click Discard | Expected: * Pending changes are discarded and record is unlocked* Application and process are closed || Step 3: Exit when pending changes are valid And Save1. Open a record2. Edit the record with valid changes3. Select Exit from backstage4. On the Pending Changes window Click Save | Expected: * Pending changes are saved and record is unlocked* Application and process are closedBug 258944 - Expert Accounts Payable: On the Save/Discard/Cancel dialog, choose Save will also prevent the app from closing || Step 4: Exit when pending changes are not valid1. Open a record2. Edit the record with invalid changes3. Select Exit from backstage | Expected: * User is informed of an error and given the opportunity to discrd changes for return to the record to fix the issue

Title: Payment - Status Hover
Steps: Step 1: Status Indicator | Expected: U Orange when CHECK_STATUS = NX Red when CHECK_STATUS = XP Green when CHECK_STATUS = O or RDECLARE @payment as int= 2DECLARE @paymenttrans as int= (SELECT TRAN_UNO FROM APT_CHECK WHERE REQUEST_NUM = @payment )SELECTCASE WHEN chq.CHECK_STATUS ='N'THEN'U Orange'WHEN chq.CHECK_STATUS = 'X' THEN 'X RED' WHEN chq.CHECK_STATUS IN ('O','R') THEN 'P Green' END [Status Indicator],chq.REQUEST_NUM,look1.DISPLAY_TEXT[Status],-- Expert StatusCASEWHEN chq.DOCUMENT_TYPE ='W'THEN'Bank File Created'ELSE 'Check Printed'END [Item text],CASEWHEN chq.DOCUMENT_TYPE ='W'THEN CASE WHEN ISNULL(EB_SENT,0)> 0 THEN'Yes'ELSE 'No'ENDWHEN chq.DOCUMENT_TYPE <>'W'THEN CASEWHEN ISNULL(chq.CHECK_NUM,0)> 0 THEN'Yes'ELSE 'No'ENDEND [Item state],EB_SENT,p2.EMPLOYEE_NAME +' ('+ p2.EMPLOYEE_CODE +')'[Created]FROM APT_CHECK chq  LEFTJOIN CXL_CODE_LOOKUP look1 ON EXPERT_PAYMENT_STATUS = look1.DB_VALUE and look1.LOOKUP_GROUP ='ExpertPaymentStatus'LEFTJOIN HBM_PERSNL p2 ON chq.CREATE_EMPL_UNO = p2.EMPL_UNO -- created byWHERE chq.REQUEST_NUM = @payment || Step 2: Hover details | Expected: - Request Number and Status come from RequestNumber and CheckStatusEnum on the Check- Where the CheckDocumentTypeEnum = 'E' the Check Printed test should change to read 'Bank File Created'- If a Check ( 'C' or 'M' ) and the CheckNumber is populated ( not 0 or NULL ) – then the check has been printed- If an electronic payment ('E') and the EB_Sent field > 0 , then the Bank File has been created​ || Step 3: Tool tips off | Expected: Hover still displays

Title: Vendor Payment Schedule - Multi Currency - Scheduling a vendor payment with multi currency invoices using Add Single Invoice option.
Steps: Step 1: Pre reqEnsure your system currency is USD. We will put in one set of invoices into Classic and another to Expert so that we can reconcile the value.You will need two sets of invoice, one for Classic and one for Expert. Each set of invoices have three invoices outlined as below. Post it1Vendor = 1101Inv No = EXPERT1 / CLASSIC1Inv Amt = 100Inv Currency = CADGL detail = 50Disb = 502Vendor = 1101Inv No = EXPERT2 / CLASSIC2Inv Amt = 100Inv Currency = GBPGL detail = 50Disb = 503Vendor = 1101Inv No = EXPERT3 / CLASSIC3Inv Amt = 100Inv Currency = USDGL detail = 50Disb = 50 | Expected: Set A will have Invoice Num = Classic1, 2 and 3Set B will have Invoice Num =  Expert1, 2 and 3Your invoices should look as attached. (If created using Classic).Expert1 and Classic1 should haveAPT_INVOICE.INV_AMT = 91.57443881...APT_INVOICE. DRUNO <> 0Expert2 and Classic2 should haveAPT_INVOICE.INV_AMT = 168.3069596....APT_INVOICE. DRUNO <> 0Expert3 and Classic3 should haveAPT_INVOICE.INV_AMT = 100APT_INVOICE. DRUNO <> 0 || Step 2: In Classic, schedule a payment with GBP. Attach CLASSIC1,2 and 3 into the schedule.Use Add to add invoices in. Add all three invoices.Generate Request. || Step 3: In Expert, schedule a payment with GBP. Attach Expert1,2 and 3 into the schedule using the ADD SINGLE INVOICE screen. || Step 4: Generate RequestCompare the data in tables. || Step 5: New rows with TRAN_TYPE = CH have been inserted in APT_INVOICE_AMT | Expected: 2x3 = 6 rows of CH tran_type inserted, with SOURCE_TRAN_UNO = APT_CHECK.TRAN_UNO || Step 6: Compare entry in APT_INVOICE_AMT for that two sets of invoices too. Check attachment for example. || Step 7: Compare the Schedule Total Amount on APT_CHECK. A check should be created. | Expected: Ensure that the following columns on the table is MATCHED with each other. The value is just a reference as this might be different based on DRUNO.  As long as the request created in Classic and Expert matched. We should be good.APT_CHECK.CHK_AMT = 218.83APT_CHECK.CURRENCY = GBPAPT_CHECK.TEN99_AMT = 218.83APT_CHECK.TC_CHK_AMT = 218.83APT_CHECK.TC_CODE = GBPAPT_CHECK.EXPERT_PAYMENT_STATUS = 'I' || Step 8: Ensure that the check amount generated is matched. | Expected: Use attached REC - Check table.sql

Title: Payment - Client: Default address (Pre 822.EX0006)
Description:
The default address display in the payment screen for vendor payment should be as follow
 
Quote Dave's: 

For a Vendor Payment ( as opposed to Employee, Client or Misc ) we should first look for an Address_Uno on APM_Vendor and use that. 
If one is not present on APM_Vendor ( i.e. the uno is 0 ) then we look for the Address_Uno on the HBM_Name record for the Vendor ( i.e. where vendor.Name_Uno = name.Name_Uno ). 
If that address_Uno is also 0, then we look for the first address that we can find that is attached to the name record ( ie. from HBM_Address where address.Name_Uno = name.Name_Uno )
 
Since the search hiearchy is APM_vendor > hbm_name > hbm_address, we will test this from the lowest hierachy for minimal setup required.
Steps:
Step 1: Data pre reqs(Note: HBM_CLIENT.ADDRESS_UNO is not exposed anywhere in Expert - must be set through SQL) Client 1- Name record has multiple addresses- Name record has default address- Client record has different default address 
Client 2- Name record has multiple addresses- Name record has default address- Client record does not have default address Client 3- Name record has multiple addresses- Name record does not have default address- Client record has default address Client 4- Name record has multiple addresses- Name record does not have default address- Client record does not have default address SELECT ''[Client Name Addresses],c.CLIENT_CODE,n.NAME,CASE WHEN c.ADDRESS_UNO = a.ADDRESS_UNO Then 'Y' ELSE 'N' END [Client Addr Default],CASE WHEN n.ADDRESS_UNO = a.ADDRESS_UNO Then 'Y' ELSE 'N' END [Name Addr Default],a.ADDRESS1,a.ADDRESS2,a.ADDRESS3,a.ADDRESS4,a.CITY,a.STATE_CODE,a.COUNTY,a.REGION_CODE,a.COUNTRY_CODE,a.ADDRESS_CODE, a.ADDRESS_UNO,a.NAME_UNO,c.CLIENT_UNOFROM HBM_ADDRESS aJOIN HBM_NAME n ON a.NAME_UNO = n.NAME_UNOJOIN HBM_CLIENT c ON n.NAME_UNO = c.NAME_UNOWHERE a.ADDRESS_UNO <> 0 --AND c.CLIENT_CODE = 'tst1'ORDER BY c.CLIENT_CODE || Step 2: Client and Name have default addressCreate client payment- use client 1 | Expected: Address set from Name default || Step 3: Only Name has address defaultCreate client payment- use client 2 | Expected: Address set from Name default || Step 4: Only Client has address defaultCreate client payment- use client 3 | Expected: Address set from first one found (this could be a bit random)Note: Address not set in classic || Step 5: No defaultsCreate a client payment- use client 4 | Expected: Address set from first one found (this could be a bit random)Note: Address not set in classic

Title: Schedule - Employee: Multi Currency - Scheduling a employee payment with multi currency advance using Add Multiple Invoice option.
Area: ExpertSuite\Financials\Accounts Payable\Payment Schedule\Add to Schedule\Employee Invoices
Steps: Step 1: Create advance and got it approved in Expenses with currency as follow:Expert1 CAD 100 || Step 2: In Expert AP, create a new payment schedule. Fill ini the header, BANK - BCAD. Add the advance through Add Invoices > Add Multiple Invoices. | Expected: Expense report is returned and added to details grid. || Step 3: Create another advance for us to reconcile with Classic, they should be similiar as Step 1's but with different report name so that we can identify them better. Classic1, CAD 100 || Step 4: Got it approved. || Step 5: In Classic AP, create a new payment schedule in Check Schedule. Also, using BCAD.Use "Generate" to add advance Classic1 | Expected: Advance added to schedule details grid. || Step 6: Compare the two advance entry in APT_ADVANCE_AMT. | Expected: They should be identical despite those unmatchable columns (LAST_MODIFIED) etc make sure they are match with their counterpart. Expert1 = Classic1 etc. || Step 7: Now post them. || Step 8: Reconcile the entries in APT_ADVANCE, APT_CHECK, APS_SCHEDULE_Z and APT_ADVAMCE_AMT. | Expected: APT_ADVANCE_AMT.BAL_ZERO_NO_FCA = Y for Classic1 and NULL for Expert1.

Title: Schedule - Employee: Multi Currency - Scheduling an employee payment with multi currency advance using Add Single Invoice option.
Area: ExpertSuite\Financials\Accounts Payable\Payment Schedule\Add to Schedule\Employee Invoices
Steps: Step 1: Create advance in Expenses with currency as follow:Expert1, CAD 100 || Step 2: In Expert AP, create a new payment schedule. Fill ini the header, BANK - BCAD. Add advance through Add Invoices > Add Single Invoice.Fill in form to locate the advance | Expected: Advance is returned and added to details grid. || Step 3: Create another advamce for us to reconcile with Classic, they should be similiar as Step 1's but with different report name so that we can identify them better. Classic1, CAD 100 || Step 4: Got the reports approved. Check the APT_ADVANCE to make sure they are match with their counterpart. Expert1 = Classic1 etc. || Step 5: In Classic AP, create a new payment schedule in Check Schedule. Also, using BCAD. Fill in the headers and click Ok. Will prompted with 'Expense and Advance Search Criteria', Cancel the window. Use 'Add' on the Detail grid instead. | Expected: Advance is returned and added to details grid. || Step 6: Compare the two Advance entry in APT_ADVANCE_AMT. | Expected: They should be identical beside these fields: DISCNT_AMT (NULL for Classic)WHELD_AMT (NULL for Classic)EXP_RPT_EMPL_UNO (zero for Classic)djo - these columns are not on APT_Advance_Amt ? || Step 7: Generate Request. || Step 8: Compare their value in APT_ADVANCE, APT_CHECK, APS_SCHEDULE_Z and APT_ADVANCE_AMT.

Title: Payment - Employee: Default address
Description:
The default address display in the payment screen for vendor payment should be as follow
 
Quote Dave's: 

For a Vendor Payment ( as opposed to Employee, Client or Misc ) we should first look for an Address_Uno on APM_Vendor and use that. 
If one is not present on APM_Vendor ( i.e. the uno is 0 ) then we look for the Address_Uno on the HBM_Name record for the Vendor ( i.e. where vendor.Name_Uno = name.Name_Uno ). 
If that address_Uno is also 0, then we look for the first address that we can find that is attached to the name record ( ie. from HBM_Address where address.Name_Uno = name.Name_Uno )

Steps: Step 1: Data pre reqsEmployee 1- Name record has multiple addresses- Name record has default addressEmployee 2- Name record has multiple addresses- Name record does not have default addressSELECT ''[Employee Name Addresses],e.EMPLOYEE_CODE,n.NAME,CASE WHEN n.ADDRESS_UNO = a.ADDRESS_UNO Then 'Y' ELSE 'N' END [Name Addr Default],a.ADDRESS1,a.ADDRESS2,a.ADDRESS3,a.ADDRESS4,a.CITY,a.STATE_CODE,a.COUNTY,a.REGION_CODE,a.COUNTRY_CODE,a.ADDRESS_CODE, a.ADDRESS_UNO,a.NAME_UNO,e.EMPL_UNOFROM HBM_ADDRESS aJOIN HBM_NAME n ON a.NAME_UNO = n.NAME_UNOJOIN HBM_PERSNL e ON n.NAME_UNO = e.NAME_UNOWHERE a.ADDRESS_UNO <> 0 --AND e.EMPLOYEE_CODE = 'nz10'ORDER BY e.EMPLOYEE_NAME || Step 2: Name has address defaultCreate employee payment- use employee 1 | Expected: Address set from Name default || Step 3: No defaultsCreate employee payment- use employee 2 | Expected: Address set from first one found (this could be a bit random)Note: Address not set in classic

Title: Payment Items - Client credit: look and feel
Steps: Step 1: General | Expected: https://aderant.sharepoint.com/RD/AP/Moscow%20Design%20Wiki/Client%20Payment%20Detail%20Form.aspx* Save & Close and Save & Add are only enabled when mandtory fields are completed* Cancel is enabled* On Save & Add the form is reset* Once payment is released, the matter credit items are non editable || Step 2: Narrative | Expected: * Supports spellcheck only* Max characters = 200 || Step 3: Client | Expected: * On change of client, the other fields are cleared* Error if client has unposted credit items (on another payment or a bill* Values testing is covered under the other test cases || Step 4: Amount | Expected: * Can't exceed avail for selected item* Can't be negative

Create vendor payment- use vendor 12. Change Address3. Save4. Reopen payment | Expected: Address is overriden- An address is defaulted on create- Override address list displays only addresses for the vendor name- On reopen of payment, the selected override address is displayed || Step 3: Vendor has addresses and Override Name has addresses1. Create vendor payment- use vendor 12. Override name with name 13. Select a different address4. Save5. Reopen payment | Expected: Name and address is overriden- An address is defaulted on create- Override address list displays only addresses for the vendor name- Can override name with a related name (only names 1 and 2 will be in the list) and the vendor address will be cleared- When name 1 is selected, and address for that name will defaulted and user can choose other addresses that belongs to name 1 only- On reopen of payment, the selected override name and address are displayed || Step 4: Vendor has addresses and Override Name does not have addresses1. Create vendor payment- use vendor 12. Override name with name 23. Save4. Reopen payment | Expected: Name is overriden and address is blank- An address is defaulted on create- Override address list displays only addresses for the vendor name- Can override name with a related name (onlt names 1 and 2 will be in the list) and the vendor address will be cleared- When name 2 is selected, there are no avail addresses- On reopen of payment, the selected override name is displayed and the address is blank || Step 5: Vendor does not have addresses but Override Name has addresses1. Create vendor payment- use vendor 22. Override name with name 13. Select a different address4. Save5. Reopen payment | Expected: Name and address is overriden- An address is not defaulted on create- Override address list is blank- Can override name with a related name (only names 1 and 2 will be in the list) - When name 1 is selected, and address for that name will defaulted and user can choose other addresses that belongs to name 1 only- On reopen of payment, the selected override name and address are displayed || Step 6: Vendor does not have address and Override Name does not have addresses1. Create vendor payment- use vendor 1 (22/11/18 JL: vendor 1 does have an address - tested with vendor 2)2. Override name with name 23. Save4. Reopen payment | Expected: Name is overriden and address is blank- An address is not defaulted on create- Override address list is blank- Can override name with a related name (onlt names 1 and 2 will be in the list) - When name 2 is selected, there are no avail addresses- On reopen of payment, the selected override name is displayed and the address is blank || Step 7: Vendor has unrelated override name and addressNote: This is to support classic1. Create an invoice in classic for vendor 1 and use over name 3 with one of it's addresses2. Create a payment in expert for vendor 1 and add the invoice. When adding the invoice select yes to use the override name and address 3. Save the payment4. Open the payment in expert | Expected: Unrelated Override name and address display - The unrelated name and address are displayed- Can't select another address for the unrelated name as the unrelated name does not appear in the selction list- Can edit the payment and save, retaining the unrelated override name and address- Can select a related name to override || Step 8: Vendor has an address that has an override name1. Create vendor payment- use vendor 12. Select an address that has an override name3. Save4. Reopen payment | Expected: Address is overriden and name displayed is the override name from the address- Address displays the override address- Override name is displaying the override name from the adress

Title: Invoice List - Grid
Steps: Step 1: Make sure each column return and display data.  Create an invoice with all data on it. || Step 2: General ChecksUse INV - grid.sql (attached but may have latest version on tfs) | Expected: Note thatDate do not display timeLookup type columns display appropriate text and code.Conversion in script might be off for a few decimal point. || Step 3: If invoice created in Classic, some new column may have NULL value || Step 4: Should be displaying Invoice CurrencyOutstanding Amont, Discount Amount, 1099 Amount, Sales Use Tax || Step 5: New from 2018/1/24Workflow grid (do not have column header, only shows workflow icon when invoice is in workflow) | Expected: Clicking it display workflow progress dialog. || Step 6: From 822.EX0004 Create by Office | Expected: US 241295 - Add Created by Office to available fields for Invoices and Paymentsselect COUNT(*) from apt_invoice ileft join HBM_PERSNL p on i.ENTRY_EMPL_UNO = p.EMPL_UNOwhere p.OFFC = 'tor' --and i.EAP_INITIATED = 'Y'and EXP_RPT_EMPL_UNO = 0

Title: Payment Items - Invoice: withholding tax
Steps: Step 1: Note:Withholding tax is what the law firm deducts from the amount paid to the vendor and pays this withholding amount to the govt. || Step 2: Pre reqs1. Set the database to use withholding taxSELECT*FROM CMS_OPTION WHERE OPTION_CODE ='WHTAX_IN_USE'UPDATE CMS_OPTION SET FLAG_VALUE ='Y'WHERE OPTION_CODE ='WHTAX_IN_USE'2. Set the withholding tax % to 10%SELECT WHOLD_PCNT FROM APM_PARMSUPDATE APM_PARMS SET WHOLD_PCNT = 10 || Step 3: Create Invoice1. Create invoice- Payment terms is set to one that has a discount of 2%- Amount = 100- Withhold tax = ON2. Add invoice details3. Post the invoice | Expected: Invoice created || Step 4: Add the invoice to a payment1. Create payment2. Add the invoice | Expected: Invoice details added with withheld amount- Discount amount = 2.00- Withheld amount is 10% of the 100 balance - Discount (98.00) = 9.80- 1099 is balance - discount = 98.00- Payment amount is Balance - discount - withheld amount (100.00 - 2.00 - 9.80_) = 88.20

Title: Vendor Payment Schedule - Scheduling PART PAID vendor invoice using ADD SINGLE
Steps: Step 1: Insert more details about the table outcomes - see payment test caseRemove the selection as that's covered by the criteria testThe generate schedule part should be covered by the create payments test. Check that it is before remiving it from here || Step 2: Create a 100USD invoices.  Post it. || Step 3: Pay half of the invoice amount, 50USD. | Expected: SELECT BALANCE FROM APT_INVOICE = 50.00 || Step 4: In Payment Schedule > Vendor Payment, fill in the headers, save. || Step 5: Add Single Invoice.Locate Invoice in the Invoice Number field. | Expected: Able to select this invoice with no validation error. || Step 6: Click Add and Close. || Step 7: Post schedule / Generate Request

Title: Schedule - Vendor: Withholding tax - add single
Steps: Step 1: Setup Withhold TaxUPDATE CMS_OPTION SET FLAG_VALUE = 'Y' WHERE OPTION_CODE = 'WHTAX_IN_USE'UPDATE APM_PARMS SET WHOLD_PCNT = 10 | Expected: Firm is now configured to 10% of withhold tax. || Step 2: Create two invoices with below criteria, they should be identical. So that we can compare the default value on Expert using ClassicInvoice Amt = 100,Pmt Term = 2%1 (Might have to create a new pmt term)Jurisdic = GSTWith'd Tax = *CheckedTax Include = NoAdd a GL Detail wih 100USDClick 'Add Tax' | Expected: Tax Include change to 'Added' || Step 3: Post them. || Step 4: Add Single Screen || Step 5: In Classic, attach one of the invoice into a vendor schedule using Add. | Expected: Discount Amount = 2.00 1099 Amount = 98.00Payment Amount = 88.20Withheld Amount = 9.80 || Step 6: In Expert AP, attach another invoice to vendor schedule using Add Single Screen | Expected: (Identical to Classic's)Discount Amount = 2.00 1099 Amount = 98.00Payment Amount = 88.20Withheld Amount = 9.80 || Step 7: Compare the entries in APT_INVOICE_AMT.select TRAN_TYPE,INV_TRAN_UNO DISCNT_AMT, PAID_AMT, TEN99_AMT, WHELD_AMT from APT_INVOICE_AMT where INV_TRAN_UNO in (InvTranUno1, InvTranUno2)and TRAN_TYPE ='CH' | Expected: Payment values matched up || Step 8: Now, Remove these invoices from the payment schedule. || Step 9: Add Multiple Screen || Step 10: In Classic, attach one of invoice into a vendor schedule using Generate. Double click on the invoice to view the payment value. | Expected: Discount Amount = 2.00 1099 Amount = 98.00Payment Amount = 88.20Withheld Amount = 9.80 || Step 11: In Expert AP, attach one of invoice into a vendor schedule using Add Multiple. Double click on the invoice to view the payment value. | Expected: (Identical to Classic's)Discount Amount = 2.00 1099 Amount = 98.00Payment Amount = 88.20Withheld Amount = 9.80 || Step 12: Compare the entries in APT_INVOICE_AMT.select TRAN_TYPE,INV_TRAN_UNO DISCNT_AMT, PAID_AMT, TEN99_AMT, WHELD_AMT from APT_INVOICE_AMT where INV_TRAN_UNO in (InvTranUno1, InvTranUno2)and TRAN_TYPE ='CH' | Expected: Payment values matched up

Title: Vendor Payment Schedule - Default 1099 Amount value on Add Single Invoice Screen.
Steps: Step 1: As attached bug, the final 1099 amount will be the lesser of  1) 1099 Amount off the invoice (converted to the schedule's bank currency)2) The sum of the final paid amount and withheld amount. || Step 2: Create a 100USD invoice with $50 of 1099 Amt. Post it || Step 3: In Expert AP > Payment Schedule > Create Payments. Fill in headers and Save. Add Single Invoice and add invoice from Step 3. | Expected: 1099 Amt = 50.00, 1099 amount of invoice. || Step 4: Change Payment Amt to $60. Generate Request and Pay the invoice. (Do it in Classic if not possible in Expert) || Step 5: Create another payment schedule and attach the same invoice. | Expected: 1099 Amt = 30.00, which is the sum of final paid amount and withheld amount. || Step 6: Remove the invoice, add the invoice using ADD MULTIPLE INVOICES.Double click to view the invoice. | Expected: 1099 Amt = 30.00, which is the sum of final paid amount and withheld amount.

Title: Invoice Entry - Ribbons
Steps: Step 1: Ribbons in Invoice Entry screen should be in the following order. || Step 2: Actions || Step 3: Save | Expected: Enable when required fields are filled in with correct validation. || Step 4: Save & Close | Expected: Enable when required fields are filled in with correct validation. Bring you back to Invoice List tab. || Step 5: Close & Add | Expected: Trigger confirmation dialog if dirty. Clears the form for the next item to be entered. || Step 6: Close | Expected: Trigger confirmation dialog if dirty. || Step 7: Release/Unrelease | Expected: Enable when status is Ready for Posting. For unrelease, only if it has been released already and NOT posted || Step 8: Post | Expected: Enable when status is Ready for Posting and not already posted || Step 9: Cancel | Expected: Enable when status is Outstanding || Step 10: Delete | Expected: Enable when saved and not released or posted || Step 11: Import || Step 12: Invoice Import || Step 13: Print || Step 14: Edit List | Expected: When status is Incomplete (I) or Ready for Posting (C) || Step 15: Tools || Step 16: Calculate Tax | Expected: Enabled when remaining balance is 0, Tax jurisdiction not NA and Tax include is yes or no || Step 17: Quick Pay | Expected: Enable when status is Outstanding || Step 18: Edit Invoice | Expected: Only show when status is Posted || Step 19: Image || Step 20: View Image | Expected: Enabled when Image is attached to Invoice, Expert or Classic. || Step 21: Attach Image | Expected: Enabled when Technical.Applications.ExpertAccountsPayable.Options.ExpertImage.IsUsingExpertImage = True || Step 22: Delete Image | Expected: Enables if using Expert Image and an image has been attached to this invoice. || Step 23: Evaluate Rules | Expected: Evaluates business rules. Enabled when status is ready for postng or incomplete || Step 24: Initiates Workflow

Title: Invoice Entry - Fields validation check
Steps: Step 1: Refer to wiki and the validation and behaviour of all the fields. This test case should also be use along with INV - DataProviders.sql Note: State Withholding Tax and Internal Reference field is added from 82 SP2 | Expected: https://aderant.sharepoint.com/RD/AP/Moscow%20Design%20Wiki/New%20Invoice.aspx || Step 2: Header || Step 3: Vendor | Expected: Return Select * from apm_vendor where inactive = 'N'Can Create New Temporary Vendor Name. When a vendor selected. these fields are defaulted :Payee Name and Address. Invalid vendor - Validation error *From 82SP2, Temp Vendor entry is not allowed if Firm Options > "Allow Temporary Vendor Name" is not ticked. 5/03/2019 - in 82SP1 EX0002, Zip and Country Code of address is also added to display. *bug 210119Bug 214532: * BUG: Data Provider for new invoices does not filter out inactive vendors- fixed- Error on attempt to save with inactive vendor.- fixed || Step 4: Overide Name and Address. | Expected: Default to Vendor entered above. || Step 5: Override (button) | Expected: Open up 'Change Name and Address' window. -- Available name and address to override in the 'Change Name and Address' screen.select vend.VENDOR_NAME, name.NAME [Related Name to Override to], address.ADDR_TYPE_CODE ,address.ADDRESS1 from APA_VENDOR_RELATED_PAYEE payeeleft join APM_VENDOR vend on vend.VENDOR_UNO = payee.VENDOR_UNOleft join hbm_name name on name.NAME_UNO = payee.RELATED_NAME_UNOleft join HBM_ADDRESS address on address.NAME_UNO = name.NAME_UNOwhere vend.VENDOR_ID = '1102' -- Put in selected vendor ID and invoice number || Step 6: Invoice Number | Expected: Allow any combination of string as long as 30 characters. Not allow to have duplicate Invoice Number for the same vendor. A validation error will pop up if the invoice is duplicated. || Step 7: Invoice DateIf Error | Expected: Must be within APM_PARMS min and max date'Date is outside minimum and maximum range'. Validate after tab out of the field.Bug 211633: BUG: AP Invoice Due Date cannot be prior to Invoice Date- fixed || Step 8: Invoice Amount | Expected: Allow amount less (greater if negative amount) than or equal to 999,999,999,999,999.99. Zero allowed || Step 9: Invoice Currency | Expected: Default from vendor record.Disabled when detail line addedMax value is 999.999.999.999.999.00 || Step 10: Spot Rate override button | Expected: Will be display when Invoice Currency <> System Currency and APM_PARMS.INV_SPOT_RATES = 'Y' || Step 11: Payment Terms | Expected: When selected, Invoice Due Date, DiscDate and Discount Amount are updated.  From 822.EX3 onwards. Bug 243131 - Remove Discount Reevaluation dialog when editing Amount field if selected Payment Term does not have a discount percentage || Step 12: Due Date | Expected: Default by Invoice Date and Payment Terms.*Bug 184719 Due date not calculating based on net terms || Step 13: " # Days Left / Overdue" | Expected: Red when overdue, green when with days leftDefault from Current Date - Due Date.Should display when invoice is new (not saved) or when EXPERT_INVOICE_STATUS <> S or X otherwise not visible || Step 14: General || Step 15: Book | Expected: Default to current user's book in HBM_PRSNL.BOOKValidate to the bank of the specified AP Type.Hide this field when multibook is not enabledDisabled after GL line is added* Bug 146913 Book not validated and not defaulted - fixed || Step 16: AP Type | Expected: Default to Vendor's APTypeIf this is changed, it should be validate to the selected Bank above. - Can't be inactive 822 EX0010* Bug 146913 AP Type not validated to Book above - fixed || Step 17: Reference | Expected: Allow string up to 30 characters as per User Story 173949. * Bug 163567 have to limit user to NOT enter more than 12 characters - fixed || Step 18: Internal Reference*From 82SP2 | Expected: Allow up to 20 varchar.Only shows up when APM_PARMS.INTERNAL_REF_ASSIGN <> N. || Step 19: Image Reference | Expected: Allow strings up to 12 character. Can be customized to allow up to 100 characters. *Bug 209891 : AP image reference field doesn't display all characters of image filenameOnly shows up when Admin > System > Expert Imaging > AP > Display Image Reference = Y. || Step 20: Hold Date | Expected: Date picker. || Step 21: Client Bill Payment Required | Expected: Check box. Do not appear when apm parm, Withhold Disb Cash Receipt Until Vendor is Paid/HOLD_DISB is checked.. When this field is missing, it is save as 'N' in APT_INVOICE. || Step 22: Separate Check | Expected: Check box. Default to APM_VENDOR.ONE_CHECK || Step 23: Tax || Step 24: Jurisidiction | Expected: Display when CMS_OPTION-TAXES_IN_USE = 'Y'.Default from Vendor record. || Step 25: Tax Include | Expected: Display when CMS_OPTION.TAXES_IN_USE = 'Y'.Default from APM_PARMS.Three optionsYes (Y)No (N) Not Applicable (X)This field becomes required and not defaulted when Taxes in use = 'Required by User' 163718 (fixed) || Step 26: Tax Report | Expected: Display when CMS_OPTION- TAXES_IN_USE = 'Y'.Claim or Hold option. Default is Claim || Step 27: Tax Claim Date | Expected: Display when CMS_OPTION - TAXES_IN_USE = 'Y'.Disabled when Tax Report is Claim.*Bug 163679. not validate and reset when status change - fixed || Step 28: Withhold Tax | Expected: Display when CMS_OPTION - Withhold Tax = 'Y'.Default to vendor setting in Entity Manager APM_VENDOR.WITHHOLD_TAX || Step 29: Withhold State TaxAdded in 82 SP2 - US 207748 | Expected: Display when CMS_OPTION - ST_WHTAX= 'Y'.Enable when selected 1099 code APL_TEN99.ST_WHELD = 'Y'Flag set as 'N' by default || Step 30: Bank | Expected: See User story 164047 || Step 31: Discount || Step 32: Discount Date | Expected: Date pickerDefault from Invoice Date and Payment Terms. || Step 33: Discount Amount | Expected: *Bug logged for label redesignUpdate along with Invoice AmountMax value is 999.999.999.999.999.00 || Step 34: Firm Paid Credit Card | Expected: Display when vendor is a set up as FPCC Vendor and has a row in APA_VENDOR_BOOK*Bug 163695 FPCC check box missing when entering a vendor with FPCC - fixed || Step 35: 1099 || Step 36: 1099 Type | Expected: Display when CMS_OPTION - 1099_IN_USE = 'Y'.Default to vendor record. select TEN99_CODE  from APM_VENDOR where vendor_id = '1111' || Step 37: 1099 Amount | Expected: Display when CMS_OPTION - 1099_IN_USE = 'Y'.Default to invoice amount or select TEN99_ADJ_AMT from apm_vendor where vendor_id ='1111' Max value is 999.999.999.999.999.00 || Step 38: Narrative | Expected: Stored in apt_text.Spell Check and Expansion codes work (Hit '=')* Bug 163705, this field will elongate when narrative is too long -fixed Note: When Generate Disb and GL Text is on, changing Narrative on invoice header WILL NOT update the Narrative of existing detail line. || Step 39: Recoverable Tax | Expected: Display when cms_option - Taxes_in_use = 'Y' and APM_PARMS.RECOV_CONT_REQD = 'Y'Max value is 999.999.999.999.999.00 || Step 40: Sales Use Tax | Expected: Display when cms_option - sales_use_tax = 'Y'.* bug 163695 not display when cmsoption is set to Y. - fixed || Step 41: EB Details1 .Have a vendor(1) with a bank account.2. Have another vendor(2) that uses the first vendor(1) as a remittance vendor and also has bank account details3. Create a complete invoice with the second vendor(2) and the AP Type that corresponds to the first vendors (1) bank.4. Using SQL, change the bank account uno to the second vendors(2) bank account5. Release the invoice | Expected: AP Types bank has valid information for the NAME_UNO attached to the REMIT_VENDOR from APT_INVOICE_AMTError on bank account do not belong to vendor 3. Bank account details default to the remit vendor(1)5. Validation errorselect REMIT_VEND_UNO,*from APM_VENDOR Select*From APT_INVOICE orderby LAST_MODIFIED desc Select*from HBA_NAME_BANK_ACCOUNT

Title: Invoice Entry - Status hover
Steps: Step 1: Note: Release and Post of Invoice using Expert is impossible at the time this test case is wrote. Will test with release and posting using classic and run status conversation script to populate Expert Invoice Status. || Step 2: Create invoices with different status (Incomplete, Ready for Posting, Release, Outstanding, Part Paid, Settled and Cancelled) || Step 3: Open the invoice and scroll to upper right where the status flag are. || Step 4: Use this sql to checkselect cms1.DISPLAY_TEXT [Status],inv.EDIT_REPORT_PRINT_REF [Audit Printed],ENTRY_EMPL_UNO [Created By],CREATE_DATE [Created Date],SOURCE [Source]from APT_INVOICE invleftjoin CXL_CODE_LOOKUP cms1 on cms1.DB_VALUE = inv.EXPERT_INVOICE_STATUS and cms1.LOOKUP_GROUP ='ExpertInvoiceStatus' || Step 5: Incomplete | Expected: Yellow 'U' flagUnpostedStatus: IncompleteAudit Printed: No Created by: (from APT_INVOICE.ENTRY_EMPL_UNO)Created On: (from APT_INVOICE.CREATE_DATE)Source: Manual || Step 6: Ready for Posting | Expected: Yellow 'U' flagUnpostedStatus: Ready for PostingAudit Printed: No Created by: (from APT_INVOICE.ENTRY_EMPL_UNO)Created On: (from APT_INVOICE.CREATE_DATE)Source: Manual || Step 7: Released | Expected: Yellow 'U' flagUnpostedStatus: ReleasedAudit Printed: No Created by: (from APT_INVOICE.ENTRY_EMPL_UNO)Created On: (from APT_INVOICE.CREATE_DATE)Source: Manual || Step 8: Outstanding | Expected: Green 'P' flagPostedStatus: OutstandingAudit Printed: No Created by: (from APT_INVOICE.ENTRY_EMPL_UNO)Created On: (from APT_INVOICE.CREATE_DATE)Source: Manual || Step 9: Part Paid | Expected: Green 'P' flagPostedStatus: Part PaidAudit Printed: No Created by: (from APT_INVOICE.ENTRY_EMPL_UNO)Created On: (from APT_INVOICE.CREATE_DATE)Source: Manual || Step 10: Settled | Expected: Green 'P' flagPostedStatus: SettledAudit Printed: No Created by: (from APT_INVOICE.ENTRY_EMPL_UNO)Created On: (from APT_INVOICE.CREATE_DATE)Source: Manual || Step 11: Cancelled | Expected: Red 'X' flagCancelledStatus: Cancelled Audit Printed: No Created by: (from APT_INVOICE.ENTRY_EMPL_UNO)Created On: (from APT_INVOICE.CREATE_DATE)Source: Manual || Step 12: Audit Printed will always be No for now until Edit Print is developed.

Steps: Step 1: CreateInvoice Security | Expected: New Invoice ribbon disabled when do not have permission. || Step 2: Check new Invoice Entry form | Expected: Top tab display Invoice (New) as title || Step 3: Required fields | Expected: VendorRemit VendorInvoice NumberInvoice Amount, CurrencyPayment TermsAP typeJurisdiction1099 Type || Step 4: Invoice Date defaulted to today's date || Step 5: Details buttons : Add New, View, Remove, Remove All | Expected: Disabled. || Step 6: Yellow 'U' flag on top right corner. | Expected: Hover over the flag brings down invoice status summary || Step 7: Default Details tabs:GLDisbursementsTaxes | Expected: Firm Paid Credit Card details tab only appear when FPCC Vendor is selected and have FPCC Invoice flag checked.

Title: Payment Items - Disbursement: multi currency
Steps: Step 1: Pre reqs CAD RatesRate: 1.092007784100000Reciprocal: 0.915744388053213 Vendor 1Has USD currency bank Client 1 Uses CAD currency Vendor 2Has CAD currency bank Client 2 Uses CAD currency || Step 2: Create a vendor payment 1 - system currencyand compare record to release version Payment1. Enter the vendor 12. Leave the default USD bank3. Enter other mandatory data4. Save Disbursment item1. Select to add a disb- Disb Currency defaults to USD2. Enter the client - Disb Currency remains as  USD3. Enter a disb code- Disb Currency remains as  USD4. Enter office 5. Enter base amount6. Save | Expected: Use: REC - Fields CDT_DISB.sql* Payment is saved in USD* Disb is saved in USD || Step 3: Create a vendor payment 2 - not system currencyand compare record to release version Payment1. Enter the vendor 22. Leave the default CAD bank3. Enter other mandatory data4. Save Disbursment item1. Select to add a disb- Disb Currency defaults to CAD2. Enter the client - Disb Currency remains as  CAD3. Enter a disb code- Disb Currency remains as  CAD4. Enter office 5. Enter amount6. Save | Expected: Use: REC - Fields CDT_DISB.sql* Payment is saved in CAD* Disb is saved in CAD || Step 4: Create a vendor payment 3 - has rates not system currencyand compare record to release version Payment1. Enter the vendor 22. Leave the default CAD bank3. Enter other mandatory data4. Save Disbursment item 11. Select to add a disb- Disb Currency defaults to CAD2. Enter the client - Disb Currency remains as  CAD3. Enter a disb code- Select Disb cost code that has unit cost in CAD currency for a specific office e.g. MILE4. Enter office - Select office e.g. MON as that has unit date for CAD of .655. Set quantity to 1- Base and bill amount set to .656. Save & Close Disbursment item 21. Select to add a disb- Disb Currency defaults to CAD2. Enter the client - Disb Currency remains as  CAD3. Enter a disb code- Select Disb cost code that has unit cost in CAD currency for a specific office e.g. MILE4. Enter office - Select office e.g. MON as that has unit date for CAD of .655. Set quantity to 1- Base and bill amount set to .656. Save & Close7. Edit quantity to 28. Save Payment1. Change amount to match the value of the disbs so there is no remaining balance2. Save | Expected: Use: REC - Fields CDT_DISB.sql Payment* Payment is saved in CAD  Disb 1* Amount is calculated from the unit rate as  CAD 0.65 and displays as C$0.65 in both form and grid * Disb is saved in CAD 0.65  Disb 2* Amount is calculated from the unit rate as  CAD 1.30 and displays as C$1.30 in both form and grid * Disb is saved in CAD 1.30 || Step 5: Post payment 1 | Expected: * all values are displayed correctly* all values are converted correctly to system currency || Step 6: Post payment 2 | Expected: * all values are displayed correctly* all values are converted correctly to system currency || Step 7: Post Payment 3 | Expected: * all values are displayed correctly* all values are converted correctly to system currency- .65 converts to .5952338522

Title: Payment Items - Disbursement: look and feel
Steps: Step 1: Note: The majority of the validation has been tested under Invoices Items || Step 2: General | Expected: https://aderant.sharepoint.com/RD/AP/Moscow%20Design%20Wiki/Disbursement%20Detail%20Form.aspx * Save & Close and Save & Add are only enabled when mandatory fields are completed (not enabled when a saved disb is first opened)* Cancel is enabled and launches the Discard/Cancel dialog if there are changes* Date is defaulted to today* On Save & Add the form is reset* Once payment is released, the disb items are non editable || Step 3: Date | Expected: * Must fall within the parameters* Disbursement must not be after matter's close date* If disbursement parameters do not allow disbursement's prior to matter open date then the date must be on or after matter open date SELECT MIN_DATE,MAX_DATE, * FROM CDM_Parms || Step 4: Matter | Expected: * Active matters* Status must allow disbs || Step 5: Phase/Task- Has active and inactive records | Expected: * Optional - Lookup- Does not return record with UNO 0- Searches on phase code, task code code and description- Returns only Active items - Has MRUs SELECT pt.INACTIVE[PT Inactive],pt.PHASE_CODE,p.INACTIVE[P Inactive],p.PHASE_DESC,pt.TASK_CODE,t.INACTIVE [T Inactive],t.TASK_DESCFROM TBL_PHTASK pt LEFT OUTER JOIN TBL_PHASE p ON pt.PHASE_CODE = p.PHASE_CODE LEFT OUTER JOIN TBL_TASK t ON pt.TASK_CODE = t.TASK_CODE WHERE pt.PHTASK_UNO > 0 ORDERBY p.PHASE_DESC,t.TASK_DESC || Step 6: Disb Type | Expected: * Mandatory* Can only be hard disb || Step 7: Disb Code- Has active and inactive records | Expected: * Mandatory - Lookup - Does not return record with UNO 0- Returns Active items  - If vendor has a restricted list (set up in entity manager) then Data provider only returns restricted list of items - MRUs are suppressed for Vendor payment due to Vendor can have a restricted list SELECT COST_CODE, COST_DESC,*FROM CDL_COST cc WHERE INACTIVE!='Y'AND ALLOW_HARD='Y'ORDER BY cc.COST_CODE SELECT v.VENDOR_ID,v.VENDOR_NAME,cc.ALLOW_HARD,vc.* FROM APA_VENDOR_COST vcJOIN APM_VENDOR v on vc.VENDOR_UNO = v.VENDOR_UNOJOIN CDL_COST cc ON vc.COST_CODE = cc.COST_CODEORDERBY v.VENDOR_ID || Step 8: Employee | Expected: * Optional unless the incurring employee is required as set in the cost codeSELECT COST_CODE, COST_DESC,INEMP_REQD,*FROM CDL_COST cc WHERE INACTIVE!='Y'AND ALLOW_HARD='Y'AND INEMP_REQD = 'Y'ORDER BY cc.COST_CODE || Step 9: Office- Has active and inactive records | Expected: * Mandatory - Drop down- Active items - Has MRUs SELECT * FROM HBL_OFFICE || Step 10: Jurisdiction- Has active and inactive records | Expected: * Mandatory- Drop down- Searches on code and desc- Active items - Has MRUs- Is active and is not output tax SELECT * FROM TBL_JURISDIC TJ1 WHERE TJ1.INACTIVE != 'Y' AND TJ1.TAX_IN_OUT != 'O' || Step 11: Location- Has active and inactive records | Expected: * Optional- Drop down- Active items  SELECT TL1.INACTIVE,TL1.LOCATION_CODE,TL1.LOCATION_DESC FROM TBL_LOCATION TL1 WHERE ( ( TL1.LOCATION_CODE != '' ) ) AND (  ( NOT ( TL1.INACTIVE='Y' ) ) ) ORDER BY TL1.LOCATION_DESC || Step 12: Authorized By Employee1. Set the disb type to require authorizing2. Set the authorizing employee e.g. against a matter. In entity Manager under Other Employees | Expected: * Optional unless the authorised employee is required as set in the cost code* Authorising employee can be set at client or matter level. As this is at matter level, if you set a different employee at both client and matter level, either is a valid authorizer. If one is not set then any employee can authorise otherwise is limited to those set - Lookup- Does not return record with UNO 0- Searches on employee code and name- Returns Active items  - Has MRUs SELECT COST_CODE, COST_DESC,AUEMP_REQD,*FROM CDL_COST cc WHERE INACTIVE!='Y'AND ALLOW_HARD='Y'AND AUEMP_REQD ='Y'ORDERBY cc.COST_CODEDECLARE @clientmattercode asvarchar (50)='TST1.1'DECLARE @matter asint= (SELECT MATTER_UNO FROM HBM_MATTER WHERE CLNT_MATT_CODE = @clientmattercode)DECLARE @client asint= (SELECT CLIENT_UNO FROM HBM_MATTER WHERE CLNT_MATT_CODE = @clientmattercode)SELECT TCA1.CLIENT_UNO,TCA1.MATTER_UNO,TCA1.ROW_UNO,TCA1.EMPL_UNO , emp.EMPLOYEE_NAME, emp.EMPLOYEE_CODEFROM TBM_CLMAT_AUEMP TCA1 JOIN HBM_PERSNL emp on TCA1.EMPL_UNO = emp.EMPL_UNOWHERE TCA1.MATTER_UNO = @matter OR TCA1.CLIENT_UNO = @clientSELECT emp.EMPLOYEE_CODE,c.CLIENT_CODE,m.CLNT_MATT_CODE,mau.CLIENT_UNO,mau.MATTER_UNO,mau.ROW_UNO,mau.EMPL_UNO FROM TBM_CLMAT_AUEMP mau JOIN HBM_PERSNL emp ON mau.EMPL_UNO = emp.EMPL_UNOLEFT JOIN HBM_CLIENT c ON mau.CLIENT_UNO = c.CLIENT_UNOLEFT JOIN HBM_MATTER m ON mau.MATTER_UNO = m.MATTER_UNOORDER BY emp.EMPLOYEE_CODE || Step 13: Currency | Expected: Always default from incurring officehttps://aderant.sharepoint.com/sites/Iknow/Expert/Internal%20Docs/Salesforce/Soft%20Disbursements%20Without%20Unit%20Rates%20Inherit%20Currency%20from%20Incurring%20Office.PDF#search=Disbursement%20default%20currencyNote: Rules for defaulting currency differ depending on the source and if the cost code has rates For CDN type disbs (those originating from disb app, billing, classic disbs)Cost code has Unit rate - default hierachy is matter then CDM parmsCost code does not have unit rate - default from incurring office || Step 14: Project | Expected: Field visible when projects in useSELECT USE_PROJ_ACC,*FROM TBM_PARMSUPDATE TBM_PARMS SET USE_PROJ_ACC = 'Y' || Step 15: Base amount | Expected: - Max length 14- Disable when first opening the form.- Default to empty and mandatoryFrom 82SP2.EX0003 and 83 US 241218 - Set Disbursement Card Base and Bill Amount to required and blank field when initialise the form.enable on form initialization, fields are blank || Step 16: Bill amount | Expected: - Bill amount is defaulted from Base amount if Bill amount is editable - Where cost code has 100% markdown and apply to base is off,  the amount will be set to zero when base amount is populated- Max length 14From 82SP2.EX0003 and 83 US 241218 - Title: Payment - Employee Manual: Create/Post/Cancel
Steps: Step 1: Pre reqs Set tax fields on:UPDATE CMS_OPTION SET FLAG_VALUE ='Y' WHERE OPTION_CODE ='SALES_USE_TX'UPDATE CMS_OPTION SET FLAG_VALUE ='Y'WHERE OPTION_CODE ='TAXES_IN_USE'UPDATE APM_PARMS SET DEFAULT_TAX_IN ='X'--Q,X,Y,N || Step 2: Create payment with detail itemType = EmployeeBank = BUSDPayment date = todayMethod = ManualCheck Number = next availAmount = 100Sales / Use Tax = 100Enter any other mandatory fieldsDetails Item amount = $100 | Expected: Payment created APT_CHECK ENTRY_STATUS = NEXPERT_PAYMENT_STATUS = CSOURCE = MREVERSAL = NPAYEE_TYPE = EDOCUMENT_TYPE = MCHECK_NUM = as enteredPERIOD = 0DRUNO = 0TC_CODE = USDTC_CHK_AMT = 100CURRENCY_CODE = USDORIGINAL_AMT = NULLCHK_AMT = 100.00 (payment currency)SALES_USE_TAX = 100.00 (payment currency)TAX_AMT = 0 Note: TEXT_ID is NULL in expert and 0 in classic - not an issue as can't process the expert payment in classic || Step 3: Post the payment | Expected: Payment posted APT_CHECK (updated) ENTRY_STATUS = REXPERT_PAYMENT_STATUS = OSOURCE = MREVERSAL = NPAYEE_TYPE = EDOCUMENT_TYPE = MCHECK_NUM = as enteredPERIOD = latest periodDRUNO = current drunoTC_CODE = USDTC_CHK_AMT = 100CURRENCY_CODE = USDORIGINAL_AMT = 0CHK_AMT = 100.00 (system currency)SALES_USE_TAX = 100.00 (system currency)TAX_AMT = 0 || Step 4: Cancel the payment- today as transaction date- comments | Expected: Payment canceled  APT_CHECK (updated) ENTRY_STATUS = REXPERT_PAYMENT_STATUS = XSOURCE = MREVERSAL = NPAYEE_TYPE = EDOCUMENT_TYPE = MCHECK_NUM = as enteredPERIOD = latest periodDRUNO = current drunoTC_CODE = USDTC_CHK_AMT = 100CURRENCY_CODE = USDORIGINAL_AMT = 0CHK_AMT = 100.00 (system currency)SALES_USE_TAX = 100.00 (system currency)TAX_AMT = 0 APT_CHECK  for contra entry created with same REQUEST_NUM ENTRY_STATUS = REXPERT_PAYMENT_STATUS = MSOURCE = MREVERSAL = YPAYEE_TYPE = EDOCUMENT_TYPE = MCHECK_NUM = copied from originalPERIOD = latest periodDRUNO = current drunoTC_CODE = USDTC_CHK_AMT = -100CURRENCY_CODE = USDORIGINAL_AMT = 0CHK_AMT = -100.00 (system currency)SALES_USE_TAX = -100.00 (system currency)TAX_AMT = 0 || Step 5: Reconcile the payments | Expected: APT_CHECK- All fields that should match, do- All fields that won't match e.g. unos, are populated with the appropriate values CHECK_LANGUAGE is set to NULL in classic on contra entry

Title: Payment - Cancel: Look and Feel
Steps: Step 1: Cancel Payment Form | Expected: - Employee is mandatory and defaults to logged on user- Cancel date is mandatorySELECT MIN_DATE,MAX_DATE FROM APM_PARMS- Reason is mandatory- Comments is optional- Comments Supports spellcheck and Expansion codes- Comments Max characters = 15000SELECT*FROM ACT_TEXT ORDER BY TEXT_ID desc- Cancel to new payment only enabled when form called from payment  form or when only one payment selected from the grid- New payment date disabled when Cancel to New is off otherwiser it's mandatory and defaults to selected payment's payment date- Cancel button enabled, cancels the form- Cancel Payment button only enabled when all mandatory fields entered || Step 2: Cancel Button from grid ribbon bar - Check and Manual Payments | Expected: - enabled when all selected items are posted || Step 3: Cancel Button from payment ribbon bar - Check and Manual payments | Expected: - enabled when item is posted || Step 4: Cancel Button from grid ribbon bar - wire and electronic paymentsSELECT AUTO_RECONCILE_WIRE,*FROM APM_PARMS--UPDATE APM_PARMS SET AUTO_RECONCILE_WIRE = 'Y' | Expected: - Enabled when all selected items are posted - Enabled when all selected items are Posted or Reconciled if auto reconcile is on, other disabled || Step 5: Cancel Button from payment ribbon bar - wire and electronic paymentsSELECT AUTO_RECONCILE_WIRE,*FROM APM_PARMS--UPDATE APM_PARMS SET AUTO_RECONCILE_WIRE = 'Y' | Expected: - Enabled item is posted - Enabled when item is Posted or Reconciled if auto reconcile is on, other disabled || Step 6: Transaction date is less than minimum1. Posted payment2. Select to cancel3. Enter transaction date that is < than the minimumSELECT MIN_DATE FROM APM_PARMS4. Cancel payment | Expected: Display error: Date is outside minimum and maximum range || Step 7: Transaction date is greater than maximum1. Posted payment2. Select to cancel3. Enter transaction date that is < than the minimumSELECT MAX_DATE FROM APM_PARMS4. Cancel payment | Expected: Display error: Date is outside minimum and maximum range
